Chinese Sentence: 我们来看下所谓的进化树 我们人类就在右上角，和动物们在一起

English Sentence: Of those roughly 29 million genes, we only have around 24,000 in our genome.
Chinese Sentence: 在动物界约2900万个基因中 我们的基因组 才仅仅拥有24000个基因

English Sentence: And if you take all animals together, we probably share less than 30,000 and probably maybe a dozen or more thousand different gene families.
Chinese Sentence: 如果把所有的动物算在一起 我们与之分享着不到30000 可能在1.2万或再多数千 的不同的基因家族

English Sentence: I view that these genes are now not only the design components of evolution.
Chinese Sentence: 现在我不仅仅将这些基因视为 进化的设计组件

English Sentence: And we think in a gene-centric view -- maybe going back to Richard Dawkins' ideas -- than in a genome-centric view, which are different constructs of these gene components.
Chinese Sentence: 而且我们要从“基因中心观点”—— 或许要追溯到理查德·道金斯的理论—— 而非“基因组中心观点”来思考 它们对这些基因组件的构造方式是不同的

English Sentence: Synthetic DNA, the ability to synthesize DNA, has changed at sort of the same pace that DNA sequencing has over the last decade or two, and is getting very rapid and very cheap.
Chinese Sentence: 合成DNA，即人工合成DNA的能力 在过去的十年或二十年里 与DNA测序的能力 在某种程度上是同步发展的 而且都变得越来越快速和廉价

English Sentence: Our first thought about synthetic genomics came when we sequenced the second genome back in 1995, and that from mycoplasma genitalium.
Chinese Sentence: 有关合成基因组的想法 是在1995年我们对第二个基因组 即生殖道支原体测序的时候想到的

English Sentence: And we have really nice T-shirts that say, you know, "I heart my genitalium."
Chinese Sentence: 我们还制作了相当不错的T恤 写着，“我爱惜我的生殖器”

English Sentence: This is actually just a microorganism.
Chinese Sentence: 这其实只不过是个微小的生物

English Sentence: But it has roughly 500 genes.
Chinese Sentence: 却拥有近500个基因

English Sentence: Haemophilus had 1,800 genes.
Chinese Sentence: 嗜血杆菌拥有1800个基因

English Sentence: And we simply asked the question, if one species needs 800, another 500, is there a smaller set of genes that might comprise a minimal operating system?
Chinese Sentence: 我们提出疑问 如果某物种需要800个基因，另一种需要500个 是否能用一套更小的基因 组成一个微小的可运作生命系统

English Sentence: So we started doing transposon mutagenesis. Transposons are just small pieces of DNA that randomly insert in the genetic code.
Chinese Sentence: 于是我们开始做转座子的突变发生 转座子是随机插入遗传编码之中

English Sentence: And if they insert in the middle of the gene, they disrupt its function.
Chinese Sentence: 的短的DNA片段 如果转座子插入到基因中间，就会扰乱基因的功能

English Sentence: So we made a map of all the genes that could take transposon insertions and we called those "non-essential genes."
Chinese Sentence: 因此我们找出 所有能够接受转座子插入的基因 并为这些“非必需基因”制作了“地图”

English Sentence: But it turns out the environment is very critical for this, and you can only define an essential or non-essential gene We also tried to take a more directly intellectual approach with the genomes of 13 related organisms, and we tried to compare all of those, to see what they had in common.
Chinese Sentence: 但结果我们发现环境对此的影响非常关键 我们只能根据 环境中确实存在的条件 来定义必需和非必需基因 我们还试图做一个更直观的研究 对13个有亲缘关系的生物 我们试图比较它们的基因组，看它们是否有相同之处

English Sentence: And we got these overlapping circles. And we found only 173 genes common to all 13 organisms.
Chinese Sentence: 于是我们得到了这些重叠的圆圈，我们发现只有173个基因 在这所有13种生物中是相同的

English Sentence: The pool expanded a little bit if we ignored one intracellular parasite; it expanded even more when we looked at core sets of genes of around 310 or so.
Chinese Sentence: 如果忽略掉一个细胞内寄生物的话 这个基因库还能扩展一点 当我们审视核心的一组 约310个基因时

English Sentence: So we think that we can expand or contract genomes, depending on your point of view here, to maybe 300 to 400 genes The only way to prove these ideas was to construct an artificial chromosome with those genes in them, and we had to do this in a cassette-based fashion.
Chinese Sentence: 基因库扩大更多 因此我们认为可以从最少500个基因 扩展或缩小 ——取决你怎么看这个问题—— 到约300到400个基因 证明这些理论的唯一方法 是以这些基因人工构建一个染色体 而且我们必须用基于表达框的方式来达到这一目的

English Sentence: We found that synthesizing accurate DNA in large pieces was extremely difficult.
Chinese Sentence: 我们发现大片段精确合成DNA 是非常非常困难的

English Sentence: Ham Smith and Clyde Hutchison, my colleagues on this, developed an exciting new method that allowed us to synthesize a 5,000-base pair virus in terms of its sequence and its biology.
Chinese Sentence: 我的同事汉姆·史密斯和克莱德·哈钦森 发明了一个让人振奋的新方法 能让我们在短短两周时间内 合成一个拥有5000个碱基对的病毒 而且在基因序列和生物学特性上

English Sentence: It was a quite exciting experiment -- when we just took the synthetic piece of DNA, injected it in the bacteria and all of a sudden, that DNA started driving the production of the virus particles that turned around and then killed the bacteria.
Chinese Sentence: 都百分百精确 那是个相当让人兴奋的实验：我们仅仅把合成的DNA片段 注进细菌中，突然之间 DNA就开始引导病毒颗粒的合成 而病毒反过来杀死了细菌

English Sentence: This was not the first synthetic virus -- a polio virus had been made a year before -- but it was only one ten-thousandth as active and it took three years to do.
Chinese Sentence: 这并非第一个合成的病毒 一年前已有某种脊髓灰质炎病毒被制造了出来 但这却是唯一达到百分之一活性的病毒 耗时三年才合成成功

English Sentence: This is a cartoon of the structure of phi X 174.
Chinese Sentence: 这是Phi X-174结构的一个动画

English Sentence: This is a case where the software now builds its own hardware, and that's the notions that we have with biology.
Chinese Sentence: 这是软件为自己构建硬件的活例子 也为我们的生物学提供了新想法

English Sentence: People immediately jump to concerns about biological warfare, and I had recent testimony before a Senate committee, and a special committee the U.S. government has set up to review this area.
Chinese Sentence: 有人立即开始担心生物武器的威胁 不久前我也在参议院委员会 和另一个由美国政府成立 旨在评价这一领域的特殊委员会上作证

English Sentence: And I think it's important to keep reality in mind, versus what happens with people's imaginations.
Chinese Sentence: 我认为最重要的是将事实牢记在心 而非人们对事情发生的想象

English Sentence: Basically, any virus that's been sequenced today -- that genome can be made.
Chinese Sentence: 基本上，任何现在已经被测序的病毒 其基因组都可以被合成

English Sentence: And people immediately freak out about things about Ebola or smallpox, but the DNA from this organism is not infective.
Chinese Sentence: 人们立马被埃博拉病毒或天花病毒之类等吓坏了 但从这些生物体中提取的DNA并不具有感染力

English Sentence: So even if somebody made the smallpox genome, that DNA itself would not cause infections.
Chinese Sentence: 因此即使有人制成了天花病毒基因组 其DNA本身并不会引发感染

English Sentence: The real concern that security departments have is designer viruses.
Chinese Sentence: 安全部门真正需要担心的是 “设计者病毒”

English Sentence: And there's only two countries, the U.S. and the former Soviet Union, that had major efforts on trying to create biological warfare agents.
Chinese Sentence: 只有两个国家，美国和前苏联 曾经花大力气 致力于生物武器的研制

English Sentence: If that research is truly discontinued, there should be very little activity on the know-how to make designer viruses in the future.
Chinese Sentence: 如果这些研究真的已经终止 那么在未来 人为制造出设计者病毒的几率微乎其微

English Sentence: I think single-cell organisms are possible within two years.
Chinese Sentence: 我想两年内制造出单细胞生物是可能的

English Sentence: And possibly eukaryotic cells, those that we have, are possible within a decade.
Chinese Sentence: 而真核细胞 我们自己拥有的这种细胞 也可能在十年内制造出来

English Sentence: So we're now making several dozen different constructs, because we can vary the cassettes and the genes that go into this artificial chromosome.
Chinese Sentence: 我们可以区分开进入这个人工基因组的 不同表达框和不同基因 使得我们能构建数十种不同的结构

English Sentence: The key is, how do you put all of the others?
Chinese Sentence: 关键是，如何把所有其他的放进来？

English Sentence: We start with these fragments, and then we have a homologous recombination system that reassembles those into a chromosome.
Chinese Sentence: 我们从这些片段开始 然后通过一个同源重组系统 将其组合到染色体中

English Sentence: This is derived from an organism, deinococcus radiodurans, that can take three million rads of radiation and not be killed.
Chinese Sentence: 这来自一种名为耐辐射奇异球菌的生物 能在三百万拉德的辐射剂量下保持活力

English Sentence: It reassembles its genome after this radiation burst in about 12 to 24 hours, after its chromosomes are literally blown apart.
Chinese Sentence: 在暴露辐射约12到24小时 其染色体几乎完全破碎的情况下 它还能将自身的染色体重新组装起来

English Sentence: This organism is ubiquitous on the planet, and exists perhaps now in outer space due to all our travel there.
Chinese Sentence: 这种生物在地球上几乎无处不在 甚至由于人类的活动 它们还可能在外太空活动

English Sentence: This is a glass beaker after about half a million rads of radiation.
Chinese Sentence: 这是玻璃烧杯 在约50万拉德辐射下的情形

English Sentence: The glass started to burn and crack, while the microbes sitting in the bottom just got happier and happier.
Chinese Sentence: 玻璃开始燃烧，爆裂 而位于底部的微生物 则似乎越来越开心

English Sentence: Here's an actual picture of what happens: the top of this shows the genome after 1.7 million rads of radiation.
Chinese Sentence: 这是实际的情形 上面是经过170万拉德辐射 之后的染色体

English Sentence: The chromosome is literally blown apart.
Chinese Sentence: 几乎已经支离破碎

English Sentence: And here's that same DNA automatically reassembled 24 hours later. It's truly stunning that these organisms can do that, and we probably have thousands, if not tens of thousands, of different species on this planet that are capable of doing that.
Chinese Sentence: 下面是24小时之后 同样的DNA自动重组的结果 这些生物能做到的真是叹为观止。 如果不是数以万计的话 也许我们还能找到数以千计 的物种也同样能够做到

English Sentence: After these genomes are synthesized, the first step is just transplanting them into a cell without a genome.
Chinese Sentence: 这些基因组合成之后 第一步就是将它们 移植到另一个没有基因组的细胞中

English Sentence: So we think synthetic cells are going to have tremendous potential, not only for understanding the basis of biology but for hopefully environmental and society issues.
Chinese Sentence: 因此我们认为合成细胞将具有巨大的前景 不仅仅在生物学基础的理解上 而且很可能帮我们应对环境和社会问题

English Sentence: For example, from the third organism we sequenced, Methanococcus jannaschii -- it lives in boiling water temperatures; its energy source is hydrogen and all its carbon comes from CO2 it captures back from the environment.
Chinese Sentence: 例如，从我们测序的第三种生物 詹氏甲烷球菌，生活在相当于水沸点的高温中 以氢作为能量来源 并依靠捕获环境中的二氧化碳为自己提供所需的碳

English Sentence: So we know lots of different pathways, thousands of different organisms now and can capture that back.
Chinese Sentence: 由此可知，通过大量不同的途径 数以千计的生物 能够捕获

English Sentence: So instead of using carbon from oil for synthetic processes, we have the chance of using carbon and capturing it back from the atmosphere, converting that into biopolymers or other products.
Chinese Sentence: 并依赖二氧化碳生存 因此我们可以通过 捕获大气中的碳 制造生物高聚物 或其他产品 来替代从石油中 工业合成的碳制品

English Sentence: We have one organism that lives off of carbon monoxide, and we use as a reducing power to split water to produce hydrogen and oxygen.
Chinese Sentence: 有种依赖一氧化碳的生物 我们利用其还原能力 使水分子破裂，制造出氢和氧

English Sentence: Also, there's numerous pathways that can be engineered metabolizing methane.
Chinese Sentence: 同样，还有许多途径 能够用来转化甲烷

English Sentence: And DuPont has a major program with Statoil in Norway to capture and convert the methane from the gas fields there into useful products.
Chinese Sentence: 杜邦公司和挪威石油公司有一大型项目 就是把挪威油气田中的甲烷 转化为有用的产品
Chinese NER Tagged: [{'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.9999895, 'index': 2, 'word': '杜', 'start': 0, 'end': 1}, {'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.9999831, 'index': 3, 'word': '邦', 'start': 1, 'end': 2}, {'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.9579655, 'index': 4, 'word': '公司', 'start': 2, 'end': 4}, {'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.98698866, 'index': 6, 'word': '挪威', 'start': 5, 'end': 7}, {'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.99970335, 'index': 7, 'word': '石油', 'start': 7, 'end': 9}, {'entity': 'I-ORG', 'score': 0.9969637, 'index': 8, 'word': '公司', 'start': 9, 'end': 11}, {'entity': 'I-LOC', 'score': 0.9999969, 'index': 15, 'word': '挪威', 'start': 21, 'end': 23}]

English Sentence: Within a short while, I think there's going to be a new field called "Combinatorial Genomics," because with these new synthesis capabilities, these vast gene array repertoires and the homologous recombination, we think we can design a robot to make maybe a million different chromosomes a day.
Chinese Sentence: 我突然想到，将有一个新的领域 “组合基因组学”很快就要诞生 因为有了这些新的合成方法 有了这么庞大的基因序列 和同源重组 我们可以设计出一个 能够每天生产近百万个染色体的机器人

English Sentence: And therefore, as with all biology, you get selection through screening, whether you're screening for hydrogen production, or chemical production, or just viability.
Chinese Sentence: 因此，所有的生物学特征 都能通过屏幕来选择 无论是制造氢 化学合成，或者仅仅是生存能力

English Sentence: To understand the role of these genes is going to be well within reach.
Chinese Sentence: 理解这些基因的功能 将变得触手可及

English Sentence: We're trying to modify photosynthesis to produce hydrogen directly from sunlight.
Chinese Sentence: 我们正尝试改进光合作用 以直接在阳光下制造出氢

English Sentence: Photosynthesis is modulated by oxygen, and we have an oxygen-insensitive hydrogenase that we think will totally change this process.
Chinese Sentence: 光合作用受氧调节 而我们使用的对氧不敏感的氢化酶 将完全改变这一过程

English Sentence: We're also combining cellulases, the enzymes that break down complex sugars into simple sugars and fermentation in the same cell for producing ethanol.
Chinese Sentence: 我们还整合了多种纤维素酶 这些酶可以把复杂的糖类分解为简单的糖类 并在同一个细胞内发酵 产生酒精

English Sentence: Pharmaceutical production is already under way in major laboratories using microbes.
Chinese Sentence: 在一些大型的实验室里 已经开始利用微生物 进行药品生产

English Sentence: The chemistry from compounds in the environment is orders of magnitude more complex than our best chemists can produce.
Chinese Sentence: 环境中化合物的化学 比我们最好的化学家制造出来的化合物

English Sentence: I think future engineered species could be the source of food, hopefully a source of energy, environmental remediation and perhaps replacing the petrochemical industry.
Chinese Sentence: 还要复杂很多 也许未来的工程物种将成为 我们的食物来源 能量来源 环境补救手段 甚至 取代石化行业

English Sentence: Let me just close with ethical and policy studies.
Chinese Sentence: 最后让我以道德和政策上的研究结束吧

English Sentence: We delayed the start of our experiments in 1999 until we completed a year-and-a-half bioethical review as to whether we should try and make an artificial species.
Chinese Sentence: 我们推迟了1999年开始的实验 直到对是否应该尝试制造人工物种这一问题进行了一年半的生物伦理学讨论后

English Sentence: Every major religion participated in this.
Chinese Sentence: 实验才继续进行 每个主要宗教都参与其中

English Sentence: It was actually a very strange study, because the various religious leaders were using their scriptures as law books, and they couldn't find anything in them prohibiting making life, so it must be OK. The only ultimate concerns were biological warfare aspects of this, but gave us the go ahead to start these experiments for the reasons we were doing them.
Chinese Sentence: 真是一项奇怪的研究 因为许多宗教领袖都以他们的教义、经文作为法律 而且不能从中找出禁止制造生命的条文 所以这应该没什么问题 最根本的担忧来自生物武器方面 但只有开始进行这些实验之后 我们才能找出从事这一切的原因

English Sentence: Right now the Sloan Foundation has just funded a multi-institutional study on this, to work out what the risk and benefits to society are, and the rules that scientific teams such as my own should be using in this area, and we're trying to set good examples as we go forward.
Chinese Sentence: 目前斯隆基金会已经资助了 一个相关的多机构参与的研究 以确定这些实验给社会带来的风险和益处 同时也为像我们这样的科学团队 在这一领域开展研究制定规则 在前进的同时我们也努力成为一个良好的榜样

English Sentence: These are complex issues.
Chinese Sentence: 有许多复杂的议题

English Sentence: Except for the threat of bio-terrorism, they're very simple issues in terms of, can we design things to produce clean energy, and provide through various simple processes.
Chinese Sentence: 除了生物恐怖主义 它们其实都很简单： 我们能否设计出生产清洁能源的工具 通过各种不同的简单步骤 或能彻底改变 发展中国家的能源生产模式

English Sentence: Thank you very much.
Chinese Sentence: 非常感谢

English Sentence: Hello voice mail, my old friend.
Chinese Sentence: 语音信箱 我的老朋友♪

English Sentence: I've called for tech support again.
Chinese Sentence: 我又打了技术支持电话♪

English Sentence: I ignored my boss's warning. I called on a Monday morning.
Chinese Sentence: 我没听老板的警告 在周一早上打的♪

English Sentence: Now it's evening, and my dinner first grew cold, and then grew mold.
Chinese Sentence: 现在已是晚上 我的食物先变凉 -- 继而发霉♪

English Sentence: I'm still on hold. I'm listening to the sounds of silence.
Chinese Sentence: 我仍被搁置 我正聆听着寂静之声♪

English Sentence: I don't think you understand. I think your phone lines are unmanned.
Chinese Sentence: 我觉得你不明白 我认为你们的电话线无人值守♪

English Sentence: I punched every touch tone I was told, but I've still spent 18 hours on hold.
Chinese Sentence: 我敲打了每个提示的按键♪ 但我还是被晾了18小时♪

English Sentence: It's not enough your software crashed my Mac, and it constantly hangs and bombs -- it erased my ROMs!
Chinese Sentence: 你们的软件不但宕了我的Mac♪ 还一直挂起和破坏 -- 擦除了我的ROM! 现在那Mac♪

English Sentence: Now the Mac makes the sounds of silence.
Chinese Sentence: 发出了寂静之声♪

English Sentence: In my dreams I fantasize of wreaking vengeance on you guys.
Chinese Sentence: 我在梦中幻想♪ 对你们实施报复♪

English Sentence: Say your motorcycle crashes.
Chinese Sentence: 咒你摩托出了车祸♪

English Sentence: Blood comes gushing from your gashes.
Chinese Sentence: 血流成河 你颤抖着♪

English Sentence: With your fading strength, you call 9-1-1 and you pray for a trained MD. But you get me.
Chinese Sentence: 拨了911 祈祷叫到专业医师 但却叫到了我♪

English Sentence: And you listen to the sounds of silence.
Chinese Sentence: 于是你只听到寂静之声♪

English Sentence: Thank you. Good evening and welcome to: "Spot the TED Presenter Who Used to Be a Broadway Accompanist."
Chinese Sentence: 谢谢 晚上好 欢迎来到 -- “见证曾是百老汇伴奏的TED演讲者"

English Sentence: When I was offered the Times column six years ago, the deal was like this: you'll be sent the coolest, hottest, slickest new gadgets.
Chinese Sentence: 当我在六年前得到纽约时报专栏的工作时 有人这样对我说: 你会拿到最酷 最热门 最华丽的新玩意儿

English Sentence: Every week, it'll arrive at your door.
Chinese Sentence: 每周都会被送到你家

English Sentence: You get to try them out, play with them, evaluate them until the novelty wears out, before you have to send them back, and you'll get paid for it. You can think about it, if you want.
Chinese Sentence: 你要试用它们 把玩它们 评估它们 玩厌了再把它们送回去 你还可以拿到工资 好好想想吧

English Sentence: So, I've always been a technology nut, and I absolutely love it.
Chinese Sentence: 我一直都是个技术控 这工作太棒了

English Sentence: The job, though, came with one small downside, and that is, they intended to publish my email address at the end of every column.
Chinese Sentence: 然而这工作有个小缺点 那就是 我的email地址会出现在每个专栏底部

English Sentence: And what I've noticed is -- first of all, you get an incredible amount of email.
Chinese Sentence: 对此我的体会是 -- 首先 你会收到无数email

English Sentence: If you ever are feeling lonely, get a New York Times column, because you will get hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of emails.
Chinese Sentence: 如果你感到孤单 就去找份纽约时报专栏的工作 因为你会收到成百 上千 上万的email。如今我收到最多的email

English Sentence: And the email I'm getting a lot today is about frustration.
Chinese Sentence: 是有关挫折的

English Sentence: People are feeling like things -- Ok, I just had an alarm come up on my screen. Lucky you can't see it.
Chinese Sentence: 人们感到 -- 唔 我的屏幕上刚弹出一个通知 好在你们看不到

English Sentence: People are feeling overwhelmed. They're feeling like it's too much technology, too fast.
Chinese Sentence: 人们感到在被淹没 他们觉得有太多技术 更新太快

English Sentence: It may be good technology, but I feel like there's not enough of a support structure.
Chinese Sentence: 有时候技术是好的 但我觉得在支持体系上还做得不够

English Sentence: There's not enough help.
Chinese Sentence: 没有足够的帮助 没有足够的精力被用于

English Sentence: There's not enough thought put into the design of it to make it easy and enjoyable to use.
Chinese Sentence: 设计易用和人们乐于使用的产品

English Sentence: One time I wrote a column about my efforts to reach Dell Technical Support, and within 12 hours, there were 700 messages from readers on the feedback boards on the Times website, from users saying, ""Me too, and here's my tale of woe."
Chinese Sentence: 有一次我写了篇专栏 记录了我呼叫戴尔技术支持的经历 不到12小时 纽约时报的网站上就出现了 超过700条读者留言。有人说 "我也是!"

English Sentence: I call it "software rage."
Chinese Sentence: "这是我的伤心往事"。我称之为软件焦虑

English Sentence: And man, let me tell you, whoever figures out how to make money off of this frustration will -- Oh, how did that get up there? Just kidding.
Chinese Sentence: 老实说 懂得在这种挫折上动脑筋 从而赚钱的人会 -- 哦 那东东怎么出来了? 开玩笑的

English Sentence: Ok, so why is the problem accelerating?
Chinese Sentence: 那为何这问题越来越严重? 一方面的原因是

English Sentence: And part of the problem is, ironically, because the industry has put so much thought into making things easier to use.
Chinese Sentence: 很讽刺的 因为行业花了大把精力 为了使产品更易于使用

English Sentence: I'll show you what I mean.
Chinese Sentence: 我来举个例子

English Sentence: This is what the computer interface used to look like, DOS.
Chinese Sentence: 这是以前计算机界面的样子 DOS

English Sentence: Over the years, it's gotten easier to use.
Chinese Sentence: 随着时间推移它变得更易于使用

English Sentence: This is the original Mac operating system.
Chinese Sentence: 这是原始的Mac操作系统

English Sentence: Reagan was President. Madonna was still a brunette.
Chinese Sentence: 里根还是总统 麦当娜还是黑头发

English Sentence: And the entire operating system -- this is the good part -- the entire operating system fit in 211 k.
Chinese Sentence: 整个操作系统 -- 这就是好的地方 -- 整个操作系统只有211k

English Sentence: You couldn't put the Mac OS X logo in 211 k!
Chinese Sentence: Mac OS X的logo都不止211k!

English Sentence: So the irony is, that as these things became easier to use, a less technical, broader audience was coming into contact with this equipment for the first time.
Chinese Sentence: 讽刺就在于 当这些东西变得更易于使用 更非技术 更广泛的受众就开始了与其的 第一次亲密接触

English Sentence: I once had the distinct privilege of sitting in on the Apple call center for a day.
Chinese Sentence: 我曾有幸在苹果的呼叫中心坐了一天

English Sentence: The guy had a duplicate headset for me to listen to.
Chinese Sentence: 接线员给了我一个旁听的耳麦

English Sentence: And the calls that -- you know how they say, "Your call may be recorded for quality assurance?"
Chinese Sentence: 那些通话 -- 你知道他们是怎么说的 "为保证服务质量，您的通话可能会被录音"

English Sentence: Uh-uh. Your call may be recorded so that they can collect the funniest dumb user stories and pass them around on a CD.
Chinese Sentence: 唔唔 您的通话可能会被录音 于是他们就能够收集最好玩的小白用户故事 刻成CD分发

English Sentence: Which they do.
Chinese Sentence: 他们真的做了

English Sentence: And I have a copy.
Chinese Sentence: 我有份拷贝

English Sentence: It's in your gift bag. No, no.
Chinese Sentence: 就在你的礼物包里。不不

English Sentence: With your voices on it!
Chinese Sentence: 里面有你的声音

English Sentence: So, some of the stories are just so classic, and yet so understandable.
Chinese Sentence: 有些故事堪称经典 然而也非常容易理解

English Sentence: A woman called Apple to complain that her mouse was squeaking.
Chinese Sentence: 一位女性向苹果抱怨说

English Sentence: Making a squeaking noise.
Chinese Sentence: 她的鼠标在吱吱叫 -- 发出嘎吱嘎吱的响声

English Sentence: And the technician said, "Well, ma'am, what do you mean your mouse is squeaking?"
Chinese Sentence: 技术人员问 "女士, 您的鼠标在吱吱叫是什么意思?"

English Sentence: She says, "All I can tell you is that it squeaks louder, the faster I move it across the screen."
Chinese Sentence: 她说 "我只知道 我让它在屏幕上动得越快它就叫得越响"

English Sentence: And the technician's like, "Ma'am, you've got the mouse up against the screen?"
Chinese Sentence: 技术人员又问 "女士, 您把鼠标贴在屏幕上动?"

English Sentence: She goes, "Well, the message said, 'Click here to continue.'"  Well, if you like that one -- how much time have we got?
Chinese Sentence: 她说 "提示里讲, '点此处继续.'"  如果你们喜欢那个故事...还剩多少时间?

English Sentence: Another one, a guy called -- this is absolutely true -- his computer had crashed, and he told the technician he couldn't restart it, no matter how many times he typed "11."
Chinese Sentence: 另一个男人的真实故事! 他的电脑宕机了 他告诉技术人员 他无法重启电脑 不管他输入多少次11

English Sentence: And the technician said, "What? Why are you typing 11?"
Chinese Sentence: 技术人员说 "啥? 您为啥要输入11?" 他说,

English Sentence: He said, "The message says, 'Error Type 11.'"  So, we must admit that some of the blame falls squarely at the feet of the users.
Chinese Sentence: "提示里讲, '错误输入11.'"  因此我们必须承认我们无法指责用户

English Sentence: But why is the technical overload crisis, the complexity crisis, accelerating now?
Chinese Sentence: 但是为何技术超载危机 复杂度危机 正在加速呢? 在硬件行业中

English Sentence: In the hardware world, it's because we the consumers want everything to be smaller, smaller, smaller.
Chinese Sentence: 因为我们消费者希望东西更小 更小 更小

English Sentence: So the gadgets are getting tinier and tinier, but our fingers are essentially staying the same size.
Chinese Sentence: 因此那些小玩意儿也变得越来越小 但我们的手指还是原来大小

English Sentence: So it gets to be more and more of a challenge.
Chinese Sentence: 因此行业正不断面临挑战

English Sentence: Software is subject to another primal force: the mandate to release more and more versions.
Chinese Sentence: 软件行业则面临另一个问题 强制发布越来越多的版本

English Sentence: it's not like buying a vase or a candy bar, where you own it.
Chinese Sentence: 如果你买了个花瓶 或是块糖 你可以拥有它. 但如果是软件

English Sentence: It's more like joining a club, where you pay dues every year, and every year, they say, "We've added more features, and we'll sell it to you for $99."
Chinese Sentence: 则更像是加入俱乐部 每年缴纳会费 于是每年 他们都会说 "我们加入了更多功能, 只卖$99."

English Sentence: I know one guy who's spent $4,000 just on Photoshop over the years.
Chinese Sentence: 我认识有人多年来单在Photoshop上就花了$4000

English Sentence: And software companies make 35 percent of their revenue from just these software upgrades.
Chinese Sentence: 软件公司将它们收益的35% 用于这些软件升级

English Sentence: I call it the Software Upgrade Paradox -- which is that if you improve a piece of software enough times, you eventually ruin it.
Chinese Sentence: 我称之为 软件升级佯谬 -- 当你增强一个软件足够多次 你最终会毁了它

English Sentence: I mean, Microsoft Word was last just a word processor in, you know, the Eisenhower administration.
Chinese Sentence: 我是说 Microsoft Word仅仅是一个文字处理器的时代 还要追溯到艾森豪威尔

English Sentence: But what's the alternative? Microsoft actually did this experiment.
Chinese Sentence: 但替代方案在哪? 微软实际做过这个实验. 他们说

English Sentence: They said, "Well, wait a minute. Everyone complains that we're adding so many features.
Chinese Sentence: "等等. 每个人都抱怨说我们加入了太多特性

English Sentence: Let's create a word processor that's just a word processor: Simple, pure; does not do web pages, is not a database."
Chinese Sentence: 让我们做一个单纯的文字处理器 简单, 纯粹, 不编辑网页, 不是数据库."

English Sentence: And it came out, and it was called Microsoft Write.
Chinese Sentence: 于是就有了 Microsoft Write

English Sentence: And none of you are nodding in acknowledgment, because it died.
Chinese Sentence: 你们中没人知道它 因为它已死

English Sentence: It tanked. No one ever bought it.
Chinese Sentence: 它被打入冷宫 没人买过它

English Sentence: I call this the Sport Utility Principle.
Chinese Sentence: 我称之为 运动器械原则. 人们喜欢将自己包围在

English Sentence: People like to surround themselves with unnecessary power, right?
Chinese Sentence: 非必须的能力中

English Sentence: They don't need the database and the website, but they're like, "Well, I'll upgrade, because, I might, you know, I might need that someday."
Chinese Sentence: 他们不需要数据库和网站 但是他们会想 "好, 我要升级, 因为我或许有一天会需要它!"

English Sentence: So the problem is: as you add more features, where are they going to go?
Chinese Sentence: 问题是 当你加入更多特性 它们会在哪儿?

English Sentence: Where are you going to stick them? You only have so many design tools.
Chinese Sentence: 你会把它们放在哪里? 你有那么多设计工具

English Sentence: You can do buttons, you can do sliders, pop-up menus, sub-menus.
Chinese Sentence: 你可以做出按钮 滑块 弹出菜单 子菜单

English Sentence: But if you're not careful about how you choose, you wind up with this.
Chinese Sentence: 但如果你不仔细选择的话 就会变成这样

English Sentence: This is an un-retouched -- this is not a joke -- un-retouched photo of Microsoft Word, the copy that you have, with all the toolbars open.
Chinese Sentence: 这是张未加修饰的 -- 不是笑话 -- 未加修饰的Microsoft Word的照片 你们都有的版本 打开了所有的工具条

English Sentence: You've obviously never opened all the toolbars, but all you have to type in is this little, teeny window down here.
Chinese Sentence: 显然你们从未打开过所有工具条 你们用于输入的就只是这~么小个窗口

English Sentence: And we've arrived at the age of interface matrices, where there are so many features and options, you have to do two dimensions, you know: a vertical and a horizontal. You guys all complain about how Microsoft Word is always bulleting your lists and underlining your links automatically.
Chinese Sentence: 我们已进入了界面矩阵时代 有那么多特性和选项 你不得不做出2维的 垂直的和水平的. 你们都抱怨过 为什么Microsoft Word总是自动为列表加项目符号 为链接加下划线

English Sentence: The off switch is in there somewhere.
Chinese Sentence: 关闭选项就在某处

English Sentence: I'm telling you -- it's there.
Chinese Sentence: 我说真的 就在某处

English Sentence: Part of the art of designing a simple, good interface, is knowing when to use which one of these features.
Chinese Sentence: 设计一个简单界面的艺术 部分在于 知道何时使用何种特性

English Sentence: So, here is the log-off dialogue box for Windows 2000.
Chinese Sentence: 这是Windows 2000的注销对话框

English Sentence: There are only four choices, so why are they in a pop-up menu?
Chinese Sentence: 只有4个选项 但为何是在弹出菜单里?

English Sentence: It's not like the rest of the screen is so full of other components that you need to collapse the choices.
Chinese Sentence: 屏幕上剩下的地方并非满是其他组件 使得你需要折叠选项

English Sentence: They could have put them all out in view.
Chinese Sentence: 他们其实可以把选项放到外面

English Sentence: Here's Apple's take on the exact same dialogue box.
Chinese Sentence: 这是苹果的同一个对话框

English Sentence: Thank you -- yes, I designed the dialogue box. No, no.
Chinese Sentence: 谢谢 -- 是我设计了这个对话框. 不不不

English Sentence: Already, we can see that Apple and Microsoft have a severely divergent approach to software design.
Chinese Sentence: 我们已经看到苹果和微软 对于软件设计有着相当不同的方法

English Sentence: Microsoft's approach to simplicity tends to be: let's break it down; let's just make it more steps.
Chinese Sentence: 微软达到简单的方法是 拆分 采用更多的步骤

English Sentence: There are these "wizards" everywhere.
Chinese Sentence: 于是这些向导变得到处都是

English Sentence: And you know, there's a new version of Windows coming out this fall.
Chinese Sentence: 你们知道 新版本的Windows今年秋天推出

English Sentence: If they continue at this pace, there's absolutely no telling where they might wind up.
Chinese Sentence: 如果他们继续这么做 没人知道 他们会做成什么样

English Sentence: "Welcome to the Type a Word Wizard." Ok, I'll bite.
Chinese Sentence: 欢迎来到 输入一个单词 向导. 好吧 让我们点"下一步"继续

English Sentence: From the drop-down menu, choose the first letter you want to type. Ok.
Chinese Sentence: 从下拉菜单中, 选择您要输入的第一个字母. 恩

English Sentence: So there is a limit that we don't want to cross. So what is the answer?
Chinese Sentence: 因此我们做事要有限度 但答案在哪?

English Sentence: How do you pack in all these features in a simple, intelligent way?
Chinese Sentence: 如何才能将所有这些特性以简单 智能的方式包装起来?

English Sentence: I believe in consistency, when possible, real-world equivalents, trash can folder, when possible, label things, mostly.
Chinese Sentence: 我信仰 "保持一致" "真实对等" "使用回收站" "使用标注"

English Sentence: But I beg of the designers here to break all those rules if they violate the biggest rule of all, which is intelligence. Now what do I mean by that?
Chinese Sentence: 但我请求在场的设计师们 打破这些规则 如果它们抵触了最大一条规则 那就是"智能". 什么意思呢?

English Sentence: I'm going to give you some examples where intelligence makes something not consistent, but it's better.
Chinese Sentence: 我会举一些例子 说明智能让某些事物 失去一致 但却更好

English Sentence: If you are buying something on the web, you're supposed to put in your address, and you're supposed to choose what country you're from, ok?
Chinese Sentence: 比如你在网上购物 你需要输入你的地址 以及你所在的国家 好了

English Sentence: There are 200 countries in the world. We like to think of the Internet as a global village.
Chinese Sentence: 世界上有200多个国家. 我们常说互联网是地球村

English Sentence: I'm sorry; it's not one yet.
Chinese Sentence: 对不起 它还不是

English Sentence: It's mainly like, the United States, Europe, and Japan.
Chinese Sentence: 主要是美国 欧洲和日本

English Sentence: So why is "United States" in the "U"s?
Chinese Sentence: 但为何美国在"U"字部?

English Sentence: You have to scroll, like, seven screensful to get to it.
Chinese Sentence: 你得要滚动7个屏才能找到它

English Sentence: Now, it would be inconsistent to put "United States" first, but it would be intelligent. This one's been touched on before, but why in God's name do you shut down a Windows PC by clicking a button called "Start?"
Chinese Sentence: 虽然把美国放在第一位会不一致 但这显得智能. 另一个老故事 看在上帝的份上 为何关闭一台Windows PC时 要点"开始"按钮?

English Sentence: Here's another pet one of mine: you have a printer.
Chinese Sentence: 另一个我经常说的故事: 你有一台打印机

English Sentence: Most of the time, you want to print one copy of your document, in page order, on that printer.
Chinese Sentence: 大多数时候 你只想打印文档的一份拷贝 按照页码顺序排列

English Sentence: So why in God's name do you see this every time you print?
Chinese Sentence: 看在上帝的份上 为何每次打印时你都会看到这个?

English Sentence: It's like a 747 shuttle cockpit.
Chinese Sentence: 看上去就像747的驾驶舱

English Sentence: And one of the buttons at the bottom, you'll notice, is not "Print."
Chinese Sentence: 看这里底部的按钮 还不是"打印"

English Sentence: Now, I'm not saying that Apple is the only company who has embraced the cult of simplicity.
Chinese Sentence: 我不是说苹果是唯一一家 将简单视为信条的公司

English Sentence: Palm is also, especially in the old days, wonderful about this.
Chinese Sentence: Palm也是 尤其是在过去 精于此道

English Sentence: I actually got to speak to Palm when they were flying high in the '90s, and after the talk, I met one of the employees.
Chinese Sentence: 我曾在90年代Palm鼎盛时去作过演讲 结束后 我遇到一位员工

English Sentence: He says, "Nice talk." And I said, "Thank you. What do you do here?"
Chinese Sentence: 他说 "很精彩" 我说 "谢谢, 你是做什么的?"

English Sentence: He said, "I'm a tap counter." I'm like, "You're a what?"
Chinese Sentence: 他说 "我是点击计数员"

English Sentence: He goes, "Well Jeff Hawkins, the CEO, says, 'If any task on the Palm Pilot takes more than three taps of the stylus, it's too long, and it has to be redesigned.' So I'm the tap counter."
Chinese Sentence: 我说 "你是啥?" 他说 "我们的CEO Jeff Hawkins说 任何在Palm Pilot上的任务如果需要超过3次点击 那就太长了, 需要重新设计.' 所以我是点击计数员."

English Sentence: So, I'm going to show you an example of a company that does not have a tap counter.
Chinese Sentence: 我来举个例子 如果一个公司没有 点击计数员

English Sentence: This is Microsoft Word. Ok, when you want to create a new blank document in Word -- it could happen.
Chinese Sentence: 这是Microsoft Word. 当你需要创建一个新文档 -- 这是能做到的!

English Sentence: You go up to the "File" menu and you choose "New."
Chinese Sentence: 你到"文件"菜单里选择"新建"

English Sentence: Now, what happens when you choose "New?" Do you get a new blank document?
Chinese Sentence: 选了"新建"后会发生什么? 你得到新文档了么?

English Sentence: You do not.
Chinese Sentence: 没有

English Sentence: On the opposite side of the monitor, a task bar appears, and somewhere in those links -- by the way, not at the top -- somewhere in those links is a button that makes you a new document.
Chinese Sentence: 在显示器的另一端 出现了一个任务栏 在这些链接之中 -- 不是在顶部 顺带一提 -- 有一个按钮会创建新文档

English Sentence: Ok, so that is a company not counting taps.
Chinese Sentence: 这就是不计算点击数的公司

English Sentence: You know, I don't want to just stand here and make fun of Microsoft ...
Chinese Sentence: 你们知道 我不想只是站在这里取笑微软

English Sentence: Yes, I do.
Chinese Sentence: 听众: 继续 David Pogue: 当然

English Sentence: The Bill Gates song!
Chinese Sentence: 比尔盖茨之歌!

English Sentence: I've been a geek forever and I wrote the very first DOS.
Chinese Sentence: 我一直是个geek 我写了第一个DOS♪

English Sentence: I put my software and IBM together; I got profit and they got the loss.
Chinese Sentence: 我把我的软件和IBM绑在一起♪ 我拿利润 他们拿亏损♪

English Sentence: I write the code that makes the whole world run.
Chinese Sentence: 我的代码让全世界运转♪

English Sentence: I'm getting royalties from everyone.
Chinese Sentence: 我向每个人收专利费♪

English Sentence: Sometimes it's garbage, but the press is snowed.
Chinese Sentence: 有时代码是垃圾 但媒体都已被忽悠♪

English Sentence: You buy the box; I'll sell the code.
Chinese Sentence: 你买硬件 我卖代码♪

English Sentence: Every software company is doing Microsoft's R&D.
Chinese Sentence: 每个软件公司都在做微软的研发♪

English Sentence: You can't keep a good idea down these days.
Chinese Sentence: 这年头你无法独享好点子♪

English Sentence: Even Windows is a hack. We're kind of based loosely on the Mac.
Chinese Sentence: 连Window也是个hack 松散地基于Mac♪

English Sentence: So it's big, so it's slow. You've got nowhere to go. I'm not doing this for praise.
Chinese Sentence: 因为它又大又慢 你没有其他选择 我不是为了受赞扬而工作♪

English Sentence: I write the code that fits the world today.
Chinese Sentence: 我的代码适用于今天的世界♪

English Sentence: Big mediocrity in every way.
Chinese Sentence: 各方面都平庸♪

English Sentence: We've entered planet domination mode.
Chinese Sentence: 我们已进入行星统治模式♪

English Sentence: You'll have no choice; you'll buy my code.
Chinese Sentence: 你没有选择 只能买我的代码♪

English Sentence: I am Bill Gates and I write the code.
Chinese Sentence: 我是比尔盖茨 我写了代码♪

English Sentence: But actually, I believe there are really two Microsofts.
Chinese Sentence: 但事实上 我相信有两个微软

English Sentence: There's the old one, responsible for Windows and Office.
Chinese Sentence: 旧的一个 要为Windows和Office负责

English Sentence: They're dying to throw the whole thing out and start fresh, but they can't.
Chinese Sentence: 他们渴望将旧东西扔掉 从头再来

English Sentence: They're locked in, because so many add-ons and other company stuff locks into the old 1982 chassis.
Chinese Sentence: 但他们不能. 他们被锁住了 因为那么多插件 和其他公司的东西都被锁在了1982年的底盘里

English Sentence: But there's also a new Microsoft, that's really doing good, simple interface designs.
Chinese Sentence: 但也有一家新的微软 做着好而简单的界面设计

English Sentence: I liked the Media Center PC. I liked the Microsoft SPOT Watch.
Chinese Sentence: 我喜欢Media Center PC. 我喜欢微软的SPOT手表

English Sentence: The Wireless Watch flopped miserably in the market, but it wasn't because it wasn't simply and beautifully designed.
Chinese Sentence: 这种无线手表可悲地在市场中受挫 但这不是因为它的设计简单和美观

English Sentence: But let's put it this way: would you pay $10 a month to have a watch that has to be recharged every night like your cell phone, and stops working when you leave your area code?
Chinese Sentence: 这样说吧 你会买个手表 每个月付$10 每晚都要跟你的手机一样充电 当你离开你的区域代码时就会罢工么?

English Sentence: So, the signs might indicate that the complexity crunch is only going to get worse.
Chinese Sentence: 迹象表明复杂度危机只会变得更糟

English Sentence: So is there any hope?
Chinese Sentence: 还有希望吗? 屏幕正变得更小

English Sentence: The screens are getting smaller, people are illuminating, putting manuals in the boxes, things are coming out at a faster pace.
Chinese Sentence: 人们正在启蒙 把手册放进盒子里 新事物出现得越来越快

English Sentence: It's funny -- when Steve Jobs came back to Apple in 1997, after 12 years away, it was the MacWorld Expo -- he came to the stage in that black turtleneck and jeans, and he sort of did this. The crowd went wild, but I had just seen -- I'm like, where have I seen this before? I had just seen the movie "Evita" --  with Madonna, and I'm like, you know what? English Sentence: There's a new place in New York where the crowds are thickest -- Ground Zero.
Chinese Sentence: 在纽约又有了个新地方 它是现在人群最拥挤的地方——世贸废墟中心。

English Sentence: Tourist: I've taken my step-daughter here from Indianapolis.
Chinese Sentence: 游客： 我把我的继女从印第安纳波利斯带到这里了。

English Sentence: This was -- out of all the tourist sites in New York City -- this was her number-one pick.
Chinese Sentence: 在纽约市众多的旅游景点中， 这是她的首选。

English Sentence: JA: Thousands now line up on lower Broadway.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆：现在成千上万的人正在下百脑汇街排队。

English Sentence: Tourist: I've been wanting to come down here since this happened.
Chinese Sentence: 游客： 自那事故以来，我一直想来这里看看。

English Sentence: JA: Even on the coldest winter days.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 即使在最寒冷的冬天。

English Sentence: To honor and remember.
Chinese Sentence: 为了悼念和铭记。

English Sentence: Tourist: It's reality, it's us. It happened here.
Chinese Sentence: 游客： 它是真实发生的，就发生在我们身上，就发生在这里。

English Sentence: This is ours.
Chinese Sentence: 这是我们共同的苦难。

English Sentence: JA: So many, in fact, that seeing has become a bit of a problem.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 事实上，人太多了，以至来这里凭吊已经 存在一些小问题。

English Sentence: Tourist: I think that people are very frustrated that they're not able to get closer to see what's going on.
Chinese Sentence: 游客： 我想人们都很沮丧， 因为他们不能靠得更近看看到底是怎样的情况。

English Sentence: JA: But that is about to change.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 但是这个将会得到改变。

English Sentence: In record time, a team of architects and construction workers designed and built a viewing platform to ease the frustration and bring people closer.
Chinese Sentence: 以创纪录的速度， 一支由建筑师和建筑工人组成的队伍 设计并建造了一个观景台来缓解这种沮丧-- 可以让人们走的更近了。

English Sentence: Man: They'll get an incredible panorama and understand, I think more completely, the sheer totality of the destruction of the place.
Chinese Sentence: 某男子： 人们将会看到一个难以置信的场景。 我想人们可以更加深刻的感受到， 世贸中心倒塌后的整体面貌。

English Sentence: JA: If you think about it, Ground Zero is unlike most any other tourist site in America.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 如果你稍微想想，你会发现世贸废墟中心并不像 美国其他绝大多数的旅游景点。

English Sentence: Unlike the Grand Canyon or the Washington Monument, people come here to see what's no longer there.
Chinese Sentence: 不像大峡谷和华盛顿山， 人们来到这里只是为了来看已经消失的东西。

English Sentence: David Rockwell: The first experience people will have here when they see this is not as a construction site but as this incredibly moving burial ground.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫洛克威尔：人们看到这个的时候，第一个感受会是， 这个不像是个建筑工地， 而是一个难以置信的移动墓地。

English Sentence: JA: The walls are bare by design, so people can fill them with their own memorials the way they already have along the current perimeter.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 那些墙被设计成光秃秃的。这样人们可以在上面写上 他们自己的悼词，就像他们已经在 周围写的那样。

English Sentence: Tourist: From our hearts, it affected us just as much.
Chinese Sentence: 游客： 这些悼词深深触动了我们的心扉。

English Sentence: JA: The ramps are made of simple material -- the kind of plywood you see at construction sites -- which is really the whole point.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆： 那些斜坡是用简单的材料搭建而成的-- 就是你在建筑工地可以看到的那种夹板-- 这个就是真正的重点。

English Sentence: In the face of America's worst destruction people are building again.
Chinese Sentence: 在面对美国所遭受的最严重的破坏的同时， 人们又开始重建。

English Sentence: Jim Axelrod, CBS News, New York.
Chinese Sentence: 吉姆·阿克吉姆艾克斯罗德，哥伦比亚广播公司，在纽约报道。

English Sentence: KA: This is not an obvious subject to be in the sensuality segment, but certainly David you are known as -- I know, a phrase you hate -- an entertainment architect.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 这个观景台并不是一个明显注重感官享受的建筑， 但是大卫，众所周知--我知道你讨厌这个词-- 你是一个娱乐场所建筑师。

English Sentence: Your work is highly sensual, even hedonistic.
Chinese Sentence: 你的作品都是很注重感官享受， 甚至是追求享乐主义的。

English Sentence: DR: I like that word.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我喜欢这个词。

English Sentence: KA: It's about pleasure -- casinos and hotels and restaurants.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 好吧。 你的作品都是关于享受的--像赌场，酒店和餐厅。

English Sentence: How did the shock that all of us -- and especially all of us in New York -- felt on the 11th of September transmute into your desire to do this thing?
Chinese Sentence: 对于我们--尤其是我们纽约人 911所带来的震惊 是怎么促使你改变从而渴望去做这样一件事情的呢？

English Sentence: DR: Well the truth of the matter is, post-September 11th, I felt myself in the role originally -- first of all as someone who lives in Tribeca and whose neighborhood was devastated, and as someone who works less than a mile from there -- that I was in the role of forcing 100 people who work with me in my firm, to continue to have the same level of enthusiasm about creating the places we had been creating.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 其实真实的原因是这样的。 911之后， 我去感受我自己原本真实的角色-- 首先我住在特里贝卡， 我的街坊邻居都被毁坏了， 而且我还在离世贸中心不到一英里的地方上班-- 在我的公司里，我曾经要求100个人和我一起工作， 一起怀着同样的热情 去创造我们一直以来创造的那些建筑。

English Sentence: In fact we're finishing a book which is called "Pleasure," which is about sensual pleasure in spaces.
Chinese Sentence: 事实上，我们将要完成一本可以称之为“享乐”的书， 内容是关于空间的感官享受。

English Sentence: But I've got to tell you -- it became impossible to do that.
Chinese Sentence: 但是我想告诉你--这本书变得不可能完成。

English Sentence: We were really paralyzed.
Chinese Sentence: 我们几乎都瘫痪了。

English Sentence: And I found myself the Friday after September 11th -- two days afterwards -- literally unable to motivate anyone to do anything.
Chinese Sentence: 就在911后的礼拜五-- 也就是事情发生两天之后-- 我发现自己基本上不能激励任何人去做任何事了。

English Sentence: We gave the office a few days off.
Chinese Sentence: 我们只好给员工放了几天假。

English Sentence: And in discussing this with other architects, we had seen people saying in the press that they should rebuild the towers as they were -- they should rebuild them 50 stories taller.
Chinese Sentence: 再跟其他的一些建筑师讨论这个问题的时候， 我们发现人们在媒体上说 那些塔楼应该按原来的样子重建起来-- 甚至要比原来还要高50层。

English Sentence: And I thought it was astonishing to speculate, as if this were a competition, on something that was such a fresh wound.
Chinese Sentence: 在我看来，真是令人吃惊的想法， 你可以想象这就像一场竞赛， 就在我们刚刚受伤的伤口上竞赛。

English Sentence: And I had a series of discussions -- first with Rick Scofidio and Liz Diller, who collaborated with us on this, and several other people -- and really felt like we had to find relevance in doing something.
Chinese Sentence: 对于这个我有过一系列的讨论-- 首先和里克斯科菲迪奥和利兹迪勒，他们和我合作建造这个项目， 还有一些其他人-- 我真的觉得我们必须找到共同点来一起做点什么。

English Sentence: And that as people who create places, the ultimate way to help wasn't to pontificate or to make up scenarios, but to help right now.
Chinese Sentence: 对于建筑师来说，最终施与帮助的方式 不是武断的发表意见或者虚构一些方案， 而是立刻采取实质性的行动。

English Sentence: So we tried to come up with a way, as a group, to have a kind of design SWAT team.
Chinese Sentence: 所以我们尝试采用一种方式， 像一个整体，组成一支类似特警一样的设计团队。

English Sentence: And that was the mission that we came up with.
Chinese Sentence: 这个就是我们提出来的任务。

English Sentence: KA: Were you conscious of suddenly -- as a designer whose work is all about fulfilling wants -- suddenly fulfilling needs?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 你是突然意识到-- 作为一个一直去满足人们欲望的设计师-- 转而去满足人们的需要吗？

English Sentence: DR: Well what I was aware of was, there was this overwhelming need to act now.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 坦白讲，我所知道的是， 有种马上采取行动的迫切需求。

English Sentence: And we were asked to participate in a few projects before this.
Chinese Sentence: 在这之前，我们就被邀请参与一些项目。

English Sentence: There was a school, PS 234, that had been evacuated down at Ground Zero.
Chinese Sentence: 有个原本在世贸废墟中心的叫PS 234 的学校被疏散了。

English Sentence: They moved to an abandoned school.
Chinese Sentence: 他们搬迁到一个废弃的学校。

English Sentence: We took about 20 or 30 architects and designers and artists, and over four days -- it was like this urban barn-raising -- to renovate it, and everyone wanted to help.
Chinese Sentence: 我们找到2，30个建筑师，设计者和艺术家， 花了超过4天的时间--就像这个城市的房屋建造一样-- 去翻新那个学校。每个人都想帮忙。

English Sentence: It was just extraordinary.
Chinese Sentence: 确实非同一般。

English Sentence: Tom Otterness contributed, Maira Kalman contributed and it became this cathartic experience for us.
Chinese Sentence: 汤姆奥特尼斯做出了贡献，迈拉卡尔曼也做出了贡献。 对于我们来说，这个成了一次很痛快的经历。

English Sentence: KA: And that was done, effectively, by October 8 or something?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特：那个项目最后很有效率的完成了，只花了3个礼拜的时间-- 差不多在10月8号之前，是吗？

English Sentence: DR: Yeah.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 是的。

English Sentence: KA: Obviously, what you faced in trying to do something as substantial as this project -- and this is only one of four that you've designed to surround the site -- you must have run up against the incredibly byzantine, entrenched bureaucracy and powers that be in New York real estate and New York politics.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 很明显，在试图建造 这个实质性的项目的同时你会面对很多事情--短片上看到的只是 你设计的环绕废墟四周的观景台的四分之一-- 你一定遇到不少困难吧， 在同那些关系复杂又盘根错节的官僚和权力部门 纽约房地产界和政界打交道的时候？

English Sentence: DR: Well, it's a funny thing.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 确实是件很有趣的事情。

English Sentence: We finished PS 234, and had dinner with a small group.
Chinese Sentence: 我们完成PS 234 的项目之后，同一个小组一起吃了晚饭。

English Sentence: I was actually asked to be a committee chair on an AIA committee to rebuild.
Chinese Sentence: 实际上我被邀请担任友邦保险有限公司重建委员会的主席。

English Sentence: And I sat in on several meetings.
Chinese Sentence: 之后我参加了一些会议。

English Sentence: And there were the most circuitous grand plans that had to do with long-term infrastructure and rebuilding the entire city.
Chinese Sentence: 很多冗长的宏伟计划被提出来， 都是与长期的基础建设和整个城市的重建相关。

English Sentence: And the fact is that there were immediate wounds and needs that needed to be filled, and there was talk about inclusion and wanting it to be an inclusive process.
Chinese Sentence: 实际的问题是，有很多紧迫的创伤和需求需要被抚慰和满足。 其中有个谈话是关于广泛性的，他们希望重建是一个广泛性的进程。

English Sentence: And it wasn't an inclusive group.
Chinese Sentence: 然而它并不是一个广泛代表性的组织。

English Sentence: So we said, what is -- KA: It was not an inclusive group?
Chinese Sentence: 所以我们说，什么是-- 库尔特： 它不是一个广泛性的组织？

English Sentence: DR: It was not an inclusive group.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 它不是。

English Sentence: It was predominantly a white, rich, corporate group that was not representative of the city.
Chinese Sentence: 它是由白人，富人和公司集团组成的组织 几乎不具有城市代表性。

English Sentence: KA: Shocking.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 令人吃惊！

English Sentence: DR: Yeah, surprising.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 确实很令人吃惊。

English Sentence: So Rick and Liz and Kevin and I came up with the idea.
Chinese Sentence: 所以里克，利兹和我想出了那个方案。

English Sentence: The city actually approached us.
Chinese Sentence: 实际上是市政府先找到我们说这个事情。

English Sentence: We first approached the city about Pier 94.
Chinese Sentence: 我们开始找到市政府是谈论94号码头的事。

English Sentence: We saw how PS 234 worked.
Chinese Sentence: 因为我们已经看到了PS 234 的项目是怎么做的。

English Sentence: The families -- the victims of the families -- were going to this pier that was incredibly dehumanizing.
Chinese Sentence: 而那些家属--遇害者的家属-- 都去那个码头，选择这个地方是非常不合理的。

English Sentence: KA: On the Hudson River?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特：在亨登河？

English Sentence: DR: Yeah. And the city actually -- through Tim Zagat initially, and then through Christyne Nicholas, then we got to Giuliani -- said, "You know we don't want to do anything with Pier 94 right now, but we have an observation platform for the families down at Ground Zero that we'd like to be a more dignified experience for the families, and a way to protect it from the weather."
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 是的。市政府实际上--一开始通过蒂姆扎加特， 然后通过克里斯特尼尼古拉斯, 最后我们找到朱利安尼市长-- 他说我们暂时不想对94号码头做什么事情， 但是如果我们能在世贸废墟中心给那些家属提供一个观景台， 那将是给那些家属们一个更加人性化的体验， 可以让他们避免风吹日晒。

English Sentence: So I went down there with Rick and Liz and Kevin, and I've got to say, it was the most moving experience of my life.
Chinese Sentence: 所以我同里克，利兹和凯文去了那里。 我不得不说，这是我生命中最感动的一次经历。

English Sentence: It was devastating to see the simple plywood platform with a rail around it, where the families of the victims had left notes to them.
Chinese Sentence: 看着简单的夹板和围栏搭成的平台，真是很让人触动 上面还有遇害者的家属留下的话语。

English Sentence: And there was no mediation between us and the experience.
Chinese Sentence: 在我们和这里的一切经历中无需任何调节

English Sentence: There was no filter.
Chinese Sentence: 没有任何的过滤。

English Sentence: And I remembered on September 11th, on 14th Street, the roof of our building -- we can see the World Trade Towers prominently -- and I saw the first building collapse from a conference room on the eighth floor on a TV that we had set up.
Chinese Sentence: 我记得9月11号，在14号街， 我们的楼房屋顶上--我们可以清晰的看到世贸大厦-- 那时我看到了第一栋楼房倒塌 就在8楼会议室安装的电视上。

English Sentence: And then everyone was up on the roof, so I ran up there.
Chinese Sentence: 然后所有人都跑到屋顶上，我也跑上去了。

English Sentence: And it was amazing how much harder it was to believe in real life than it was on TV.
Chinese Sentence: 真的非常令人惊讶， 比起在电视上看到的场景，真的很难相信它会在现实生活中发生。

English Sentence: There was something about the comfort of the filter and how much information was between us and the experience.
Chinese Sentence: 有种关于过滤的安慰。 在我们和现实体验之间有太多的信息。

English Sentence: So seeing this in a very simple, dignified way was a very powerful experience.
Chinese Sentence: 所以说通过这种简单 而又威严的方式观看是一种非常强大的体验。

English Sentence: So we went back to the city and said we're not particularly interested in the upgrade of this as a VIP platform, but we've spent some time down there.
Chinese Sentence: 所以后来我们又回到市政府那里，跟他们说， 我们现在对把94号码头升级成贵宾看台的想法一点兴趣都没有， 但是我们确实在这件事上花了些时间。

English Sentence: At the same time the city had this need.
Chinese Sentence: 同时市政府也有这样的需要。

English Sentence: They were looking for a solution to deal with 30 or 40 thousand people a day who were going down there, that had nowhere to go.
Chinese Sentence: 他们想要找到一个方案 去处理每天3,4万 去那里又没有其它地方可去的人群。

English Sentence: And there was no way to deal with the traffic around the site.
Chinese Sentence: 同时他们也没有办法去控制废墟周围的交通。

English Sentence: So dealing with it is just an immediate master plan.
Chinese Sentence: 所以解决这个问题成了一个迫在眉睫的总体规划。

English Sentence: There was a way -- there had to be a way -- to get people to move around the site.
Chinese Sentence: 那里应该有一个通道--而且必须有个通道-- 让人们在废墟周围移动起来。

English Sentence: KA: But then you've got to figure out a way -- we will skip over the insanely tedious process of getting permits and getting everybody on board -- but simply funding this thing.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 但是之后你必须找出一个办法-- 我们就跳过那些获得批准 和让每个人各就各位的令人疯狂而厌烦的过程--简单来讲关于钱这个事情。

English Sentence: It looks like a fairly simple thing, but this was a half a million dollar project?
Chinese Sentence: 虽然看上去是个相当简单的事情， 但是怎么说这差不多也是个50万美元的项目吧？

English Sentence: DR: Well, we knew that if it wasn't privately funded, it wasn't going to happen.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 确实。我们知道如果没有私人出资的话， 它将没法实现。

English Sentence: And we also, frankly, knew that if it didn't happen by the end of the Giuliani administration, then everyone who we were dealing with at the DOT and the Police Department and all of the -- we were meeting with 20 or 30 people with the city at a time, and it was set up by the Office of Emergency Management.
Chinese Sentence: 坦白来讲，我们也知道如果不能 在朱利安尼市长任期内启动， 我们得重新和那些政府人员打交道， 包括交通部，警察局，所有这些政府部门的人-- 我们每次开会的2，30个政府部门的人一起。 后来是应急管理办公室启动了这个项目。

English Sentence: This incredible act on their part, because they really wanted this, and they sensed that this needed to happen.
Chinese Sentence: 对于他们来说确实是个很好的举措，因为他们真的很需要这个， 而且他们察觉到这个势在必行。

English Sentence: KA: And there was therefore this ticking clock, because Giuliani was obviously out three months after that.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 因此就有了这个时间截点了？ 我们知道朱莉安尼在那3个月后就离任了。

English Sentence: DR: Yeah. So the first thing we had to do was find a way to get this -- we had to work with the families of the victims, through the city, to make sure that they knew this was happening.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 是的。 所以我们要做的第一件事情就是通气-- 我们必须和遇难者家属一起 通过市政府，来确保他们都知道这个项目。

English Sentence: Because this didn't want to be a surprise.
Chinese Sentence: 因为我们不想这个项目让大家觉得突然。

English Sentence: And we also had to be as under the radar screen as we could be in New York, because the key was not raising a lot of objection and sort of working as quietly as possible.
Chinese Sentence: 而且我们还得在纽约尽可能的低调行事， 因为关键是不要引起很多的反对声音， 某种程度上尽可能悄悄地工作。

English Sentence: We came up with the idea of setting up a foundation, mainly because when we found a contractor who would build this, he would not agree to do this, even if we would pay him the money.
Chinese Sentence: 我们想到建立基金， 主要是因为当我们找到一个可能承建这个项目的承包商的时候， 他很可能不会同意做这个项目，即使我们会支付费用给他。

English Sentence: There needed to be a foundation in place.
Chinese Sentence: 所以我们需要一个基金。

English Sentence: So we came up with a foundation, and actually what happened was one major developer in New York -- KA: Who shall remain nameless, I guess?
Chinese Sentence: 于是我们就建立了一个基金，实际上主要是 纽约一个大开发商-- 库尔特： 我猜是谁甘愿隐姓埋名呢？

English Sentence: DR: Yeah. His initials are JS, and he owns Rockefeller Center, if that helps anyone -- volunteered to help.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 他的名字首字母是JS，而且他拥有洛克菲勒中心， 希望这个可以帮大家猜猜--他志愿帮助我们。

English Sentence: And we met with him.
Chinese Sentence: 后来我们和他见面。

English Sentence: The prices from the contractors were between five to 700,000 dollars.
Chinese Sentence: 承包商们的报价从5美元到70万美元都有。

English Sentence: And Atlantic-Heydt, who's the largest scaffolding contractor in the country, volunteered to do it at cost.
Chinese Sentence: 而美国最大的脚手架承包商亚特南迪克海特， 志愿以成本价承建这个项目。

English Sentence: So this developer said, "You know what, we'll underwrite the entire expense."
Chinese Sentence: 所以那个大开发商说：“你知道吗，我们会支付整个费用。”

English Sentence: And we said, "That's incredible!"
Chinese Sentence: 而我们说：“真是好极了！”

English Sentence: And I think this was the 21st, and we knew this had to be built and up by the 28th.
Chinese Sentence: 我想那天是21号， 而我们知道这个观景台必须在28号之前完工。

English Sentence: And we had to start construction the next day.
Chinese Sentence: 我们必须在第二天就开始建造。

English Sentence: We had a meeting that evening with his contractor of choice, and the contractor showed up with the drawings of the platform about half the size that we had drawn it.
Chinese Sentence: 那天晚上我们跟那个承包商开了个会， 那个承包商展示了观景台的草图， 可是它只有我们设计的一半大小。

English Sentence: KA: Sort of like the Spinal Tap scene where you get the tiny little Stonehenge, I guess?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特：我猜有点像脊椎塔里的场景， 从那里可以看到微小的巨石阵？

English Sentence: DR: In fact, it was as if this was going to be window-washing scaffolding.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 实际上，它就像一个为擦窗户准备的脚手架。

English Sentence: There was no sense of the fact that this is next to Saint Paul -- that this is really a place that needs to be kind of dignified, and a place to reflect and remember.
Chinese Sentence: 一点都不符合当时的场景--紧挨着圣保罗教堂-- 那是一个需要庄严的地方， 一个需要尊重和纪念的地方。

English Sentence: And I've got to say that we spent a lot of time in putting this together, watching the crowds that gathered at Saint Paul -- which is just to the right -- and moving around the site.
Chinese Sentence: 我不得不说我们花了那么多时间 把这个搭建起来，看着那些聚集在圣保罗大教堂的拥挤的人群-- 正好在右边--在废墟周围移动

English Sentence: And I live down there, so we spent a lot of time looking at the need.
Chinese Sentence: 我住在那里，所以我们花了很长的时间去了解人们的需要。

English Sentence: And I think people were amazed at two things -- I think they were amazed at the destruction, but I think there was a sense of disbelief about the heroics of New Yorkers that I found very moving.
Chinese Sentence: 我想人们会因为两个事情而感到震惊-- 他们会因破坏而感到震惊， 但是我想人们也会因怀疑 纽约人感人的英雄主义而感到震惊。

English Sentence: Just the sort of everyday heroics of New Yorkers.
Chinese Sentence: 就是某种纽约人的日常的英雄主义。

English Sentence: So we were in this meeting and the contractor literally said, "I'm going to lock the door, because this developer will not agree to have you leave till you've signed off on this."
Chinese Sentence: 所以在那个会议上，那个承包商着字着句的说， “我要把门锁起来，因为开发商 不会同意在你们签订这个合约之前放你们走的。”

English Sentence: And we said, "Well, this is half the size, it doesn't have any of the design features that have been agreed upon by everyone -- everyone in the city.
Chinese Sentence: 而我们说：“但是这只有一半大小， 也没有我们之前同意的任何设计特色 包括城市里的每一个人。

English Sentence: We'd have to go back to the beginning to do this."
Chinese Sentence: 我们必须从头开始做这个项目。”

English Sentence: And I convinced him that we should leave the room with the agreement to build it as designed.
Chinese Sentence: 最后我说服了他，在我们离开会议室之前 我们达成一致，按照原先的设计重新建造。

English Sentence: The next day I got an email from the developer saying that he was withdrawing all funding.
Chinese Sentence: 第二天我收到开发商的邮件， 他说要撤掉所有的资金。

English Sentence: So we didn't know what to do, but we decided to cast a very wide net.
Chinese Sentence: 我们不知道怎么办， 但是我们决定要撒一张大网。

English Sentence: We emailed out letters to as many people as we could -- several people in the audience here -- who were very helpful.
Chinese Sentence: 我们给尽可能多的人发了邮件-- 包括很多在场的听众--他们都提供了很好的帮助。

English Sentence: KA: There was no thought of abandoning ship at that point?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 那个时候就没有想过要放弃吗？

English Sentence: DR: No. In fact I told the contractor to go ahead.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 没有。事实上，我告诉那个承包商继续施工。

English Sentence: He had already ordered materials based on my go-ahead.
Chinese Sentence: 他也已经按照我的要求订购了材料。

English Sentence: We knew that one way or another this was going to happen.
Chinese Sentence: 我们知道不管怎么样，这个项目总会完成。

English Sentence: And we just felt it had to happen.
Chinese Sentence: 我们只是觉得它必须完成。

English Sentence: KA: You were funding it yourself and with contributions and this foundation.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 后来你就自己出资，连同一些捐助和这个基金完成这个项目。

English Sentence: Richard, I think very correctly, made the point at the beginning -- before all the chair designers came out -- about the history of chair designers imposing aesthetic solutions on this kind of universal, banal, common problem of sitting.
Chinese Sentence: 我记得理查德 在刚开始就提到-- 就是在所有的项目首席设计师意识到之前-- 他说一直以来首席设计师 对这种很平常的设计问题都追求一种审美方案。

English Sentence: It seems to me with this, that it was the opposite of that.
Chinese Sentence: 但是对我来说， 这个项目却恰恰相反。

English Sentence: This was an unprecedented, singular design problem.
Chinese Sentence: 因为这是个前所未有的，独一无二的设计问题。

English Sentence: DR: Well here's the issue: we knew that this was not in the sense of -- we think about the site, and think about the need for a memorial.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 确实，这就是问题所在。 我们知道这个项目确实没有审美的特色-- 我们考虑了这个遗址，考虑到人们可能需要一种纪念碑一样的东西。

English Sentence: It was important that this not be categorized as a memorial.
Chinese Sentence: 但是有一点很重要，这个项目不是一种纪念物。

English Sentence: That this was a place for people to reflect, to remember -- a kind of quiet place.
Chinese Sentence: 而是供人们来凭吊和纪念的场所-- 很肃穆的场所。

English Sentence: So it led us to using design solutions that created as few filters between the viewer -- as we said about the families' platform -- and the experience as possible.
Chinese Sentence: 这就使得我们选用了这种设计方案， 尽可能少的在观众和真实的体验之间产生过滤-- 就像我们之前说的家属看台一样。

English Sentence: It's all incredibly humble material.
Chinese Sentence: 这个看台全都是用难以置信的普通的材料，

English Sentence: It's scaffolding and plywood.
Chinese Sentence: 就是脚手架和夹板。

English Sentence: And it allows -- by sort of the procession of the movement, up by Saint Paul's and down the other side -- it gives you about 300 feet to go up 13 feet from the ground to where you get the 360 degree view.
Chinese Sentence: 它可以使得观众移动起来， 可以上到圣保罗教堂那边然后从另一边下去。 它提供了300英尺长的通道，并可以把你带到离地13英尺的高度， 从那里可以看到360度的视角。

English Sentence: But the design was driven by a need to be quick, cheap, safe, respectful, flexible.
Chinese Sentence: 但是这个设计一直考虑到快速，廉价，安全，庄严和灵活性方面的需求。

English Sentence: One of the other things is this is designed to be moveable.
Chinese Sentence: 这其中的一个要求就是可以移动。

English Sentence: Because when we looked at the four platforms around the site, one of which is an upgrade of the families' platform, we knew that these had to be moveable to respond to changing conditions, and the changing definition of what Ground Zero is.
Chinese Sentence: 因为当我们看到废墟周围的四个平台， 其中一个是从家属看台更新而来的， 所以我们考虑到这些必须可以移动， 来应对不停改变的环境， 和对于世贸废墟中心是什么的这种定义的改变。

English Sentence: KA: Your work -- I mean, we've talked about this before -- a lot of your work, I think, is informed by your belief in, or your focus on the temporariness of all things and the evanescence of things, and a kind of "Eat, drink, and be merry, for tomorrow we die," sort of sense of existence.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 你的作品--我们之前已经讨论过这个问题-- 我想很多你的作品都是基于你的一种信念，或者说你专注于 表现所有事物的临时性和短暂性。 像“吃，喝，享乐，因为我们明天可能就会死”， 这种及时行乐的观念。

English Sentence: This is clearly not a work for the ages.
Chinese Sentence: 而这明显不是一个会长久存在的作品。

English Sentence: You know, a couple of years this thing isn't going to be here.
Chinese Sentence: 你知道，很多年之后，这个东西将不会存在了。

English Sentence: Did that require, as an architect, a new way of thinking about what you were doing?
Chinese Sentence: 作为一个建筑师， 这会要求你重新思考你那时正在做的东西吗？

English Sentence: To think of it as this purely temporary installation?
Chinese Sentence: 去把它作为一个纯粹的临时性的建筑来考虑？

English Sentence: DR: No, I don't think so.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我不这样认为。

English Sentence: I think this is, obviously, substantially different from anything we'd ever thought about doing before, just by the nature of it.
Chinese Sentence: 在我看来，这个是有实质性的不同 相对于我们之前做的任何项目比起来

English Sentence: Where it overlaps with thoughts about our work in general is, number one -- the notion of collaboration as a sort of way to get things done.
Chinese Sentence: 一般来讲，除了对于我们工作的一些想法之外， 还有一个重要的概念--就是以某种方式联合起来一起把事情完成的概念。

English Sentence: And Kevin Kennon, Rick Scofidio, Liz Diller and all the people within the city -- Norman Lear, who I spoke to four hours before our deadline for funding, offered to give us a bridge loan to help us get through it.
Chinese Sentence: 凯文肯农，里克斯科菲迪奥,利兹迪勒 和城市里的所有人-- 诺曼李尔, 在我们寻找资金的截止日期前的4个小时，我在跟他谈话， 他提供我们短期过度贷款来帮我们顺利度过难关。

English Sentence: So the notion of collaboration -- I think this reinforces how important that is.
Chinese Sentence: 回到前面说的合作的概念-- 我想这个例子更加印证了这个概念的重要性。

English Sentence: And in terms of the temporary nature of it, our goal was not to create something that would be there longer than it needed to be.
Chinese Sentence: 对于你所说的短暂性， 我们的目标不是去建造一个 比对它的实际需求还要长的建筑。

English Sentence: I think what we were most interested in was promoting a kind of dialogue that we felt may not have been happening enough in this city, about what's really happening there.
Chinese Sentence: 我想我们最感兴趣的是促进一种关于这个城市正在发生的事情的对话， 我觉得这种对话目前在这个城市还不够。 它是关于这个城市正在发生的事情的。

English Sentence: And a day or two before it opened was Giuliani's farewell address, where he proposed the idea of all of Ground Zero being a memorial.
Chinese Sentence: 在这个观景台开放的前一两天，正好是朱利安尼的离任致辞， 他提出一个想法，把整个世贸废墟中心建成一个纪念碑。

English Sentence: Which was very controversial, but it resonated with a lot of people.
Chinese Sentence: 虽然这个想法引起了很大的争议，但是它也在很多人之间引起了共鸣。

English Sentence: And I think regardless of what the position is about how this sacred piece of land is to be used, having it come out of actually seeing it in a real encounter, I think makes it a more powerful dialogue.
Chinese Sentence: 我想不管那个地方是关于什么， 不管这片神圣的土地将作何用途， 只要让人们的想法产生碰撞， 这就成了一个非常强有力的对话。

English Sentence: And that's what we were interested in.
Chinese Sentence: 而这个就是我们所感兴趣的。

English Sentence: So that, very much, is in the realm of things I've been interested in before.
Chinese Sentence: 所以说，也是属于 我之前一直感兴趣的领域。

English Sentence: KA: It seems to me, among other things, a lovely piece of civic infrastructure.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 在我看来，跟其他的建筑物相比，这是一件很可爱的市政基础建设。

English Sentence: It enables that conversation to get serious.
Chinese Sentence: 它使对话变得严肃。

English Sentence: And six months after the fact -- and only a few months away from the site being cleaned -- we are very quickly, now, getting to the point where those conversations about what should go there are getting serious.
Chinese Sentence: 就在袭击之后的6个月-- 也就是废墟被清理干净后的几个月-- 我们就很快的让 关于在废墟上建什么的谈话变得严肃而认真。

English Sentence: Do you have -- having been as physically involved in the site as you have been doing this project -- have any ideas about what should or shouldn't be done?
Chinese Sentence: 作为一个建筑师，已经深入到废墟现场， 去做这个项目，那么关于这个废墟--你有没有什么建议关于 应该做什么，不应该做什么？

English Sentence: DR: Well, I think one thing that shouldn't be done is evaluate -- I think right now the discussion is a very closed discussion on the master plan.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我想有一件事情是不应该做的，那就是评价-- 我发现现在的讨论都非常接近关于总体规划的讨论。

English Sentence: The Protetch Gallery recently had a show on ideas for buildings, which had some sort of inventive ideas of buildings.
Chinese Sentence: 最近普罗德施画廊举办了一个关于建筑理念的展览， 那里有些很新的建筑理念。

English Sentence: KA: But it had some really terrible ideas.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 但是也有很多糟糕的理念。

English Sentence: DR: And it also felt a little bit like a kind of competition of ideas, where I think the focus of ideas should be on master planning and uses.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 它有点像个观念的竞赛， 我想理念的焦点应该放在总体的规划和使用上。

English Sentence: And I think there should be a broader -- which there's starting to be -- the dialogue is really opening up to, what does this site really want to be?
Chinese Sentence: 我想应该有一个更加宽广的思路--就像正在开始改变的那样。 对话真的正在展开， 关于这个废墟到底应该变成什么？

English Sentence: And I truly believe until the issue of memorial is sorted out, that it's going to be very hard to have an intelligent discussion.
Chinese Sentence: 我坚持认为，除非关于建纪念碑的想法被放弃了， 不然很难有什么明智的讨论。

English Sentence: There's a few discussions right now that I think are very positive, about depressing the West Side Highway and connecting this over, so that there's one uninterrupted piece of land.
Chinese Sentence: 现在有一些讨论我觉得非常的可行， 关于降下西边高速公路，然后把这里连接起来， 这样就有一个不受干扰的地方了。

English Sentence: KA: Well, I think that's interesting.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 这个想法很有趣。

English Sentence: And it gets to another issue that was probably inappropriate to discuss six months ago, but perhaps isn't now, which is, not many of us love the World Trade Center as a piece of architecture, as what it had done to this city and that huge plaza.
Chinese Sentence: 它让我想起另外一个问题，可能并不是很合适 在六个月前讨论，但是现在也许可以了。 我们很多人并不喜欢这个城市里有世贸中心这个建筑， 还有那个巨大的广场。

English Sentence: Is this an opportunity, is the silver lining -- a silver lining, here -- to rebuild some more traditional city grid, or not?
Chinese Sentence: 你觉得现在是一个机会吗-- 很有希望的机会--去重建 一些更加传统的城市建筑？

English Sentence: DR: I think there's a real opportunity to engage in a discussion of why we live in cities.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我想这倒真是一个机会开始讨论 我们为什么居住在城市。

English Sentence: And why do we live in places where such dissimilar people collide up against us each day?
Chinese Sentence: 为什么我们住在这样一个地方，如此不一样的人 每天彼此之间都有很多冲突？

English Sentence: I don't think it has much to do with 50 or 60 or 70 or 80 thousand new office spaces, regardless of what the number is.
Chinese Sentence: 我不认为新建5万，6万，7万，或者8万新办公室有多少意义， 不管你建多少。

English Sentence: So yeah, I think there is a chance to re-look at how we think about cities.
Chinese Sentence: 所以说，这是一个机会，重新审视我们是怎样看待城市。

English Sentence: And in fact, there's a proposal on the table now for building number seven.
Chinese Sentence: 事实上，已经有一个方案在讨论，是关于新建7号楼的。

English Sentence: KA: Which was the building just north of the Towers?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 就是世贸塔楼北边的那个建筑？

English Sentence: DR: Right, which the towers fell into.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 对的，塔楼正好倒在它的上面。

English Sentence: And the reason that's been held up is essentially by community outrage that they're not re-opening the street to connect that back to the rest of the city.
Chinese Sentence: 之所以一直耽搁主要是因为来自于社区居民的愤怒 他们一直关闭街道。 这个街道是连接城市的。

English Sentence: I think a public dialogue -- I think, you know, I'd like to see an international competition, and a call for ideas for uses.
Chinese Sentence: 所以我想要一个公开的对话--你知道的， 我想看到一个国际化的竞争， 来征集建设方案。

English Sentence: KA: Whether it's arts, whether it's housing, whether it's what amount of shopping?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 不论它是艺术品，房屋， 还是大量的商场吗？

English Sentence: DR: Right. And we're looking for other things.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 对的。我们正在探索其他的东西。

English Sentence: This small foundation we put together is looking for other ways to help.
Chinese Sentence: 我们所建立的这个小基金正在寻求其他能够帮助的方式。

English Sentence: Including taking a small piece adjacent to the site and inviting 10 architects who currently don't have a voice in New York to do artist housing.
Chinese Sentence: 比如，在废墟附近找块小地方， 邀请10个目前在纽约还没有声望的建筑师 来作为艺术家住房。

English Sentence: And find other ways to encourage the discussion to be against sort of monolithic, single solutions, and more about a multiplicity of things.
Chinese Sentence: 同时寻找其他的方式鼓励更多的讨论 来反对单一的方案， 我们需要更多关于事物的多样性。

English Sentence: KA: Before we end, I know you have a piece of digital video of the experience of being on this platform?
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 在我们结束之前，我知道你还有一个短片要展示 是关于在这个观景台上的真实体验的

English Sentence: DR: John Kamen -- who's here, actually -- put together a two and a half minute piece that shows the platform in use.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 约翰卡门--就是短片上这个人--做了一个 2分半钟的短片来展示这个看台。

English Sentence: So I thought that would be good to end with.
Chinese Sentence: 所以我认为这是个很好的结束方式。

English Sentence: DR: We're looking from Fulton Street, west.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我们正从富尔顿街的西面看过去。

English Sentence: One of the tricky issues we had with the Giuliani administration was I had forgotten how anti-graffiti he was.
Chinese Sentence: 在我们和朱利安尼之间有个很有意思的问题， 我之前忘记了朱利安尼非常反对涂鸦。

English Sentence: And essentially our structure was designed to be written on.
Chinese Sentence: 而实质上我们的建筑就是用来涂写的。

English Sentence: KA: As you say, it's not a memorial.
Chinese Sentence: 库尔特： 就像你说的，它不是一个纪念碑。

English Sentence: But were you conscious of memorials? The Vietnam Memorial?
Chinese Sentence: 但是你之前有考虑过纪念碑吗？比如越战纪念碑？

English Sentence: Those kinds of forms?
Chinese Sentence: 这之类的一些形式？

English Sentence: DR: We certainly did as much research as we could, and we were conscious of other memorials.
Chinese Sentence: 大卫： 我们当然是做了尽可能多的研究， 我们也关注过其他的一些纪念碑。

English Sentence: And also the complexity and length of time they really take to do.
Chinese Sentence: 我们研究了它们的复杂性和实际上花费的时间。

English Sentence: It's 350 people on the committee for Oklahoma City, which is why we thought of this as a sort of ad-hoc, spontaneous solution that expanded on Union Square and the places that were ad-hoc memorials in the city already.
Chinese Sentence: 实际上是因为俄克拉何马州的委员会上的350个人， 让我们觉得这个应该是自己组织的，自发的方案 来作为联合广场的延伸 也是这个城市里一个自发组织的纪念碑。

English Sentence: The scaffolding you can see built up over the street is de-mountable.
Chinese Sentence: 你可以看到建在那个街道上方的脚手架，它是可以拆卸的。

English Sentence: What's interesting now is the nature of the site has totally changed, so that what you're aware of is not just the destruction of the buildings in Ground Zero, but all of the buildings around it -- and the scars on the building around it, which are enormous.
Chinese Sentence: 有趣的是，现在那个废墟的自然面貌已经彻底改变了， 以至你们现在所注意到的 不是在世贸中心的一些倒塌建筑物的碎块， 而是围绕在废墟周围的建筑-- 和它周围建筑上的伤痕，那些巨大的伤痕。

English Sentence: This shows Saint Paul's on the left.

English Sentence: With all the legitimate concerns about AIDS and avian flu -- and we'll hear about that from the brilliant Dr. Brilliant later today -- I want to talk about the other pandemic, which is cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension -- all of which are completely preventable for at least 95 percent of people just by changing diet and lifestyle.

English Sentence: And what's happening is that there's a globalization of illness occurring, that people are starting to eat like us, and live like us, and die like us. Chinese Sentence: 而目前的情况是 疾病的全球化正在发生， 人们开始以我们一样的方式吃饭、生活以及死亡。 举例来说，在一代人的时间内， 亚洲人患心脏病、肥胖症以及糖尿病 的比率即从最低的群体之一攀升至最高。 而在非洲大多数国家， 心血管疾病致死的人数与HIV和艾滋病 致死的人数相同。

English Sentence: So there's a critical window of opportunity we have to make an important difference that can affect the lives of literally millions of people, and practice preventive medicine on a global scale.

English Sentence: Heart and blood vessel diseases still kill more people -- not only in this country, but also worldwide -- than everything else combined, and yet it's completely preventable for almost everybody.

English Sentence: It's not only preventable; it's actually reversible.
