Chinese Sentence: 因为伐木公司进入森林，大面积砍伐树木， 摧毁整片的树林，所以黑猩猩正在消失。

English Sentence: They're disappearing in the heart of their range in Africa because the big multinational logging companies have come in and made roads -- as they want to do in Ecuador and other parts where the forests remain untouched -- to take out oil or timber.
Chinese Sentence: 在非洲黑猩猩活动区域的中心，它们正在消失 因为跨国伐木公司巨头进入森林，修建道路—— 而他们也想在厄瓜多尔 以及其他森林未被开发的地区做同样的事情—— 他们要而开采大量的石油或木材。

English Sentence: And this has led in Congo basin, and other parts of the world, to what is known as the bush-meat trade.
Chinese Sentence: 这导致刚果盆地和世界其他地区兴起了 所谓的“丛林肉”交易。

English Sentence: This means that although for hundreds, perhaps thousands of years, people have lived in those forests, or whatever habitat it is, in harmony with their world, just killing the animals they need for themselves and their families -- now, suddenly, because of the roads, the hunters can go in from the towns.
Chinese Sentence: 这意味这，虽然几百年，也许是几千年以来， 生活在那些森林里，或者是其他栖息地的人们， 与大自然和谐共处，只捕杀所需的动物 只为自己及家人所需—— 而现在，一瞬间，新筑的道路， 使猎人能够从城里进入森林。

English Sentence: They shoot everything, every single thing that moves that's bigger than a small rat; they sun-dry it or smoke it.
Chinese Sentence: 这些人射杀一切，射杀每一个活动的物体 只要比老鼠大，他们都会捕来晒干或是熏烤。

English Sentence: And now they've got transport; they take it on the logging trucks or the mining trucks into the towns where they sell it.
Chinese Sentence: 他们还有交通工具，他们可以乘着伐木卡车或是采矿卡车 把猎物带进城，再卖掉。

English Sentence: And people will pay more for bush-meat, as it's called, than for domestic meat -- it's culturally preferred.
Chinese Sentence: 在某些文化中，人们愿意高价购买这些“野味”， 而不喜欢养殖动物的肉。

English Sentence: And it's not sustainable, and the huge logging camps in the forest are now demanding meat, so the Pygmy hunters in the Congo basin who've lived there with their wonderful way of living for so many hundreds of years are now corrupted.
Chinese Sentence: 这不是可持续的，而那些驻扎在森林里的大型伐木营 也需要大量的肉类，所以刚果盆地里的俾格米猎人们 他们原本上百年来在森林里和谐安居 现在这种生活也遭到了破坏。

English Sentence: They're given weapons; they shoot for the logging camps; they get money.
Chinese Sentence: 有人给他们武器，他们为伐木营射杀动物，获得金钱。

English Sentence: Their culture is being destroyed, along with the animals upon whom they depend.
Chinese Sentence: 他们的文化正遭受破坏， 他们生存所依赖的动物也同样遭到毁灭。

English Sentence: So, when the logging camp moves, there's nothing left.
Chinese Sentence: 所以，当伐木营离开时，当地往往被洗劫一空。

English Sentence: We talked already about the loss of human cultural diversity, and I've seen it happening with my own eyes.
Chinese Sentence: 我们之前已经讨论过，人类文化的多样性正在不断地丧失， 而我本人亲眼目睹了这一切的发生。

English Sentence: And the grim picture in Africa -- I love Africa, and what do we see in Africa?
Chinese Sentence: 虽然我爱非洲，但当我们将目光投向非洲严酷的现实， 我们又看到了什么呢？

English Sentence: We see deforestation; we see the desert spreading; we see massive hunger; we see disease and we see population growth in areas where there are more people living on a certain piece of land than the land can possibly support, and they're too poor to buy food from elsewhere.
Chinese Sentence: 我们看到森林被砍伐， 沙漠扩大，饥荒肆虐， 我们看到疾病蔓延，人口增长 使得有限土地上所居住的人越来越多 超出了土地所能供养的极限， 而他们又极端贫穷，无力从其他地方购买食物。

English Sentence: Were the people that we heard about yesterday, on the Easter Island, who cut down their last tree -- were they stupid?
Chinese Sentence: 我们昨天所讨论的复活节岛上的人， 他们砍掉了岛上最后的一棵树——他们真的愚蠢吗？

English Sentence: Didn't they know what was happening?
Chinese Sentence: 他们真的不知道当时即将发生什么事情吗？

English Sentence: Of course, but if you've seen the crippling poverty in some of these parts of the world it isn't a question of "Let's leave the tree for tomorrow."
Chinese Sentence: 他们清楚得很，可是，要是你看到在世界的某些角落 人们所过的赤贫的生活 那么，所谓为明天留下一棵树也就不是问题了。

English Sentence: "How am I going to feed my family today?
Chinese Sentence: 你想的是：“今天我要怎么养活家人？

English Sentence: Maybe I can get just a few dollars from this last tree which will keep us going a little bit longer, and then we'll pray that something will happen to save us from the inevitable end."
Chinese Sentence: 也许，砍掉最后这棵树，我还能换来几块钱 这样我们还能稍微多活几天， 之后，再祈祷是否有奇迹 把我们从死亡中拯救出来。”

English Sentence: So, this is a pretty grim picture.
Chinese Sentence: 瞧，这就是严酷的现实。

English Sentence: The one thing we have, which makes us so different from chimpanzees or other living creatures, is this sophisticated spoken language -- a language with which we can tell children about things that aren't here.
Chinese Sentence: 将我们与黑猩猩及其他生物区分开的， 就是我们复杂的口头语言—— 我们用这种语言，可以告诉我们的孩子 那些尚未发生的事情。

English Sentence: We can talk about the distant past, plan for the distant future, discuss ideas with each other, so that the ideas can grow from the accumulated wisdom of a group.
Chinese Sentence: 我们告诉他们遥远的历史，或是未来的计划， 还可以讨论彼此的想法， 让这些思想在一群人累积起来的智慧中不断发展。

English Sentence: We can do it by talking to each other; we can do it through video; we can do it through the written word.
Chinese Sentence: 我们可以通过相互交谈做到这一点， 还可以通过视频或文字。

English Sentence: And we are abusing this great power we have to be wise stewards, and we're destroying the world.
Chinese Sentence: 而如今，我们正在滥用语言的能力，没有当好地球聪明的管家， 我们正在摧毁地球。

English Sentence: In the developed world, in a way, it's worse, because we have so much access to knowledge of the stupidity of what we're doing.
Chinese Sentence: 从某种角度来说，发达国家做得更糟糕， 这是因为，我们可以更便捷地得到知识 更了解我们所做的事是多么的愚蠢。

English Sentence: Do you know, we're bringing little babies into a world where, in many places, the water is poisoning them?
Chinese Sentence: 大家知道吗，在很多地方， 新生儿喝的水都是有毒的。

English Sentence: And the air is harming them, and the food that's grown from the contaminated land is poisoning them.
Chinese Sentence: 空气也在伤害他们， 食物也生长在受污染的土地上，毒害他们。

English Sentence: And that's not just in the far-away developing world; that's everywhere.
Chinese Sentence: 而这并不只是发生在遥远的发展中国家，世界各地都是如此。

English Sentence: Do you know we all have about 50 chemicals in our bodies we didn't have about 50 years ago?
Chinese Sentence: 大家知道吗，我们现在体内有50余种化学元素 50年前在我们体内是不存在的。

English Sentence: And so many of these diseases, like asthma and certain kinds of cancers, are on the increase around places where our filthy toxic waste is dumped.
Chinese Sentence: 很多疾病，像是哮喘 以及某些癌症， 在有毒垃圾堆放的地方这些疾病的发生率都在增加。

English Sentence: We're harming ourselves around the world, as well as harming the animals, as well as harming nature herself -- Mother Nature, that brought us into being; Mother Nature, where I believe we need to spend time, where there's trees and flowers and birds for our good psychological development.
Chinese Sentence: 世界各地，人们都在伤害自己， 伤害动物，伤害大自然。 大自然母亲，赋予我们生命的自然。 大自然，我们要长于斯乐于斯的大自然， 草长莺飞，花香鸟语 令我们怡情的大自然。

English Sentence: And yet, there are hundreds and hundreds of children in the developed world who never see nature, because they're growing up in concrete and all they know is virtual reality, with no opportunity to go and lie in the sun, or in the forest, with the dappled sun-specks coming down from the canopy above.
Chinese Sentence: 然而，在发达国家， 成千上万的孩子都没有见过大自然， 因为他们在混凝土的世界里长大 他们所知了解的都是虚拟现实， 他们没有机会躺在太阳下， 走进森林，躺在大树下 让斑驳的阳光洒满全身。

English Sentence: As I was traveling around the world, you know, I had to leave the forest -- that's where I love to be.
Chinese Sentence: 当我环游世界时， 我就得离开森林——那里是我心爱的的地方。

English Sentence: I had to leave these fascinating chimpanzees for my students and field staff to continue studying because, finding they dwindled from about two million 100 years ago to about 150,000 now, I knew I had to leave the forest to do what I could to raise awareness around the world.
Chinese Sentence: 我就必须告别这些神奇的黑猩猩 我的学生和研究基地的工作人员留下，继续研究 因为，了解到这些黑猩猩的数量 从100年前的200万只减少到如今的15万只， 我知道，我必须离开丛林， 尽我所能，提高全世界对这一切的意识程度。

English Sentence: And the more I talked about the chimpanzees' plight, the more I realized the fact that everything's interconnected, and the problems of the developing world so often stem from the greed of the developed world, and everything was joining together, and making -- not sense, hope lies in sense, you said -- it's making a nonsense.
Chinese Sentence: 对于黑猩猩的困境介绍得越多， 我就越发觉，世界万物都相互依存， 发展中国家的问题 常常是源于发达国家的贪婪， 所有的事都纠缠在一起，到头来却毫无理性， 大家说希望是建立在理性的基础上——但这一切却毫无理性。

English Sentence: How can we do it?
Chinese Sentence: 我们怎么来面对呢？

English Sentence: Somebody said that yesterday.
Chinese Sentence: 昨天有人说到这一点，

English Sentence: And as I was traveling around, I kept meeting young people who'd lost hope.
Chinese Sentence: 我所到之处，也经常见到对未来不存希望的年轻人。

English Sentence: They were feeling despair, they were feeling, "Well, it doesn't matter what we do; eat, drink and be merry, for tomorrow we die.
Chinese Sentence: 他们绝望， 他们说：“不管我们做什么都无所谓。 吃喝玩乐就好，反正总有一死。

English Sentence: Everything is hopeless -- we're always being told so by the media."
Chinese Sentence: 一切都没有希望——媒体一直这样向我们灌输。”

English Sentence: And then I met some who were angry, and anger that can turn to violence, and we're all familiar with that.
Chinese Sentence: 我也遇到一些愤怒的人， 这些愤怒会转为暴力， 我们对此也很熟悉。

English Sentence: And I have three little grandchildren, and when some of these students would say to me at high school or university, they'd say, "We're angry," or "We're filled with despair, because we feel you've compromised our future, and there's nothing we can do about it."
Chinese Sentence: 我自己有三个小孙子， 每当有些高中生或大学生跟我聊， 他们说：“我们很愤怒，” 或者是，“我们很绝望， 因为你们霸占了我们的未来，而我们对此无能为力。”

English Sentence: And I looked in the eyes of my little grandchildren, and think how much we've harmed this planet since I was their age.
Chinese Sentence: 我会看着我的孙儿的眼睛， 想当我像他们那么小，一直到现在，人类对地球造成了多少伤害

English Sentence: I feel this deep shame, and that's why in 1991 in Tanzania, I started a program that's called Roots and Shoots.
Chinese Sentence: 我非常惭愧，所以1991年在坦桑尼亚， 我启动了“根与芽”这个项目。

English Sentence: There's little brochures all around outside, and if any of you have anything to do with children and care about their future, I beg that you pick up that brochure.
Chinese Sentence: 外面有我们的小宣传册， 如果大家关心孩子们的未来，想与孩子们一起做些什么， 请大家拿一本宣传册看看。

English Sentence: And Roots and Shoots is a program for hope.
Chinese Sentence: “根与芽”是一个希望工程。

English Sentence: Roots make a firm foundation.
Chinese Sentence: “根”是坚实的基础。

English Sentence: Shoots seem tiny, but to reach the sun they can break through brick walls.
Chinese Sentence: “芽”看上去虽小， 但是，为了阳光它可以钻透砖墙。

English Sentence: See the brick walls as all the problems that we've inflicted on this planet.
Chinese Sentence: 把砖墙看作我们 给地球带来的问题。

English Sentence: Then, you see, it is a message of hope.
Chinese Sentence: 这样一来，瞧，这就是希望的讯息。

English Sentence: Hundreds and thousands of young people around the world can break through, and can make this a better world.
Chinese Sentence: 世界上，成千上万的年轻人 能够取得突破，让世界变得更好。

English Sentence: And the most important message of Roots and Shoots is that every single individual makes a difference.
Chinese Sentence: “根与芽”要传递的信息中，最重要的是 每一个人都可以做出贡献。

English Sentence: Every individual has a role to play.
Chinese Sentence: 每一个人在此都有自己的角色。

English Sentence: Every one of us impacts the world around us everyday, and you scientists know that you can't actually -- even if you stay in bed all day, you're breathing oxygen and giving out CO2, and probably going to the loo, and things like that -- you're making a difference in the world.
Chinese Sentence: 每天我们中的每个人都在影响着世界， 在座的科学家们都知道，不可能有人对世界没有影响—— 即使你天天躺在床上，你也在吸入氧气 呼出二氧化碳，你也会去上厕所， 还有其他类似的事情。 每一个人都在影响着我们的世界。

English Sentence: So, the Roots and Shoots program involves youth in three kinds of projects.
Chinese Sentence: 所以，“根与芽”组织 召集青年人，致力于三种项目。

English Sentence: And these are projects to make the world around them a better place.
Chinese Sentence: 这些项目目的是改变世界，让世界变得更好。

English Sentence: One project to show care and concern for your own human community.
Chinese Sentence: 一个项目是关怀自己所属的社区。

English Sentence: One for animals, including domestic animals -- and I have to say, I learned everything I know about animal behavior even before I got to Gombe and the chimps from my dog, Rusty, who was my childhood companion.
Chinese Sentence: 另一个是关爱动物，包括家养动物——我必须要说， 我早就对动物行为谙熟于心 早在我去贡贝前，我的狗鲁斯比就教给我这些知识， 它是我童年的伙伴。

English Sentence: And the third kind of project: something for the local environment.
Chinese Sentence: 第三类项目，是关心当地环境

English Sentence: So what the kids do depends first of all, how old are they -- and we go now from pre-school right through university.
Chinese Sentence: 孩子们具体做些什么，是根据他们的年纪而定—— 小的有学前班的孩子，大的有大学生。

English Sentence: It's going to depend whether they're inner-city or rural.
Chinese Sentence: 还要看他们住在哪里，是城市还是乡村。

English Sentence: It's going to depend if they're wealthy or impoverished.
Chinese Sentence: 此外还依据他们的家庭状况是富裕还是贫穷。

English Sentence: It's going to depend which part, say, of America they're in.
Chinese Sentence: 还要根据他们住在美国的哪部分。

English Sentence: We're in every state now, and the problems in Florida are different from the problems in New York.
Chinese Sentence: 美国的每个州都有我们的分支机构 弗罗里达的问题就跟纽约的不同。

English Sentence: It's going to depend on which country they're in -- and we're already in 60-plus countries, with about 5,000 active groups -- and there are groups all over the place that I keep hearing about that I've never even heard of, because the kids are taking the program and spreading it themselves.
Chinese Sentence: 我们还要依照不同国家，制定不同的具体任务—— 至今，我们拥有5000个活跃的团队，覆盖了60余个国家—— 有些团队的所在地的地名我以前从来没听说过 正是因为有了这些孩子的积极参与， 推广项目，我才听说这些地方。

English Sentence: Why?
Chinese Sentence: 他们为什么参与？

English Sentence: Because they're buying into it, and they're the ones who get to decide what they're going to do.
Chinese Sentence: 因为他们接受这种信念， 他们要自己决定自己的未来。

English Sentence: It isn't something that their parents tell them, or their teachers tell them.
Chinese Sentence: 这并不是父母，亦或是老师 要他们去做的事。

English Sentence: That's effective, but if they decide themselves, "We want to clean this river and put the fish back that used to be there.
Chinese Sentence: 听师长的话，也许会更方便，但是如果由孩子们自己来做决定， “我们要清洁这条河， 让原本居住在这儿的鱼回来。

English Sentence: We want to clear away the toxic soil from this area and have an organic garden.
Chinese Sentence: 我们要将这个地区的有毒土壤清理干净， 使它变成有机花园。

English Sentence: We want to go and spend time with the old people and hear their stories and record their oral histories.
Chinese Sentence: 我们要多花些时间陪老年人， 听他们讲故事，记录下他们口述的历史。

English Sentence: We want to go and work in a dog shelter.
Chinese Sentence: 我们要去犬类收养中心工作，

English Sentence: We want to learn about animals. We want ... " You know, it goes on and on, and this is very hopeful for me.
Chinese Sentence: 我们要了解各种动物。我们还要...” 各位，我无法历数所有这些。在我看来，这就是希望。

English Sentence: As I travel around the world 300 days a year, everywhere there's a group of Roots and Shoots of different ages.
Chinese Sentence: 一年中有300天我都在世界的某一个角落旅行， 那些地方都有不同年龄的人参与的“根与芽”项目。

English Sentence: Everywhere there are children with shining eyes saying, "Look at the difference we've made."
Chinese Sentence: 所到之处，都有孩子睁着闪亮的眼睛，告诉我： “看看我们做出的变化。”

English Sentence: And now comes the technology into it, because with this new way of communicating electronically these kids can communicate with each other around the world.
Chinese Sentence: 现在我们有了高科技的帮助， 因为有了这种新的电子交流方式 孩子们可以跨越大洋相互交流。

English Sentence: And if anyone is interested to help us, we've got so many ideas but we need help -- we need help to create the right kind of system that will help these young people to communicate their excitement.
Chinese Sentence: 如果任何人有兴趣给我们帮助，而且我们的确有很多的想法 需要帮助才能得以实现。 我们需要创造更适合年轻人交流心声的平台。

English Sentence: But also -- and this is so important -- to communicate their despair, to say, "We've tried this and it doesn't work, and what shall we do?"
Chinese Sentence: 但同样重要的是，让他们倾诉自己的失望，让他们可以说出： “我们试过了，可这样行不通，该怎么办？”

English Sentence: And then, lo and behold, there's another group answering these kids who may be in America, or maybe this is a group in Israel, saying, "Yeah, you did it a little bit wrong. This is how you should do it."
Chinese Sentence: 马上，就会有另一个小组给这些孩子提供解答 他们可能在美国，也许是在以色列， 说：“是的，你这里做错了一点。你应该这么做。”

English Sentence: The philosophy is very simple.
Chinese Sentence: 其中的哲学其实很简单。

English Sentence: We do not believe in violence.
Chinese Sentence: 我们反对暴力。

English Sentence: No violence, no bombs, no guns.
Chinese Sentence: 不需要暴力，不要炸弹，不要枪支。

English Sentence: That's not the way to solve problems.
Chinese Sentence: 这不是解决问题的方法。

English Sentence: Violence leads to violence, at least in my view.
Chinese Sentence: 至少在我看来，暴力只能导致暴力。

English Sentence: So how do we solve?
Chinese Sentence: 那我们要怎样解决问题呢？

English Sentence: The tools for solving the problems are knowledge and understanding.
Chinese Sentence: 知识和理解，就是我们解决问题的工具。

English Sentence: Know the facts, but see how they fit in the big picture.
Chinese Sentence: 了解真相，同时了解真相在全局中的位置。

English Sentence: Hard work and persistence --don't give up -- and love and compassion leading to respect for all life.
Chinese Sentence: 努力和坚持——不要放弃—— 爱和同情心能引导我们尊重所有的生命。

English Sentence: How many more minutes? Two, one?
Chinese Sentence: 我还有几分钟？两分钟，一分钟？

English Sentence: Chris Anderson: One -- one to two.
Chinese Sentence: 克里斯•安得森：一到两分钟。

English Sentence: Jane Goodall: Two, two, I'm going to take two.
Chinese Sentence: 珍妮•古道尔：两分钟，我需要两分钟。

English Sentence: Are you going to come and drag me off?
Chinese Sentence: 你们会冲上了把我拉下去吗？

English Sentence: Anyway -- so basically, Roots and Shoots is beginning to change young people's lives.
Chinese Sentence: 总而言之，“根与芽”正在 改变年轻人的生活。

English Sentence: It's what I'm devoting most of my energy to.
Chinese Sentence: 这正是我倾注大部分精力的工作。

English Sentence: And I believe that a group like this can have a very major impact, not just because you can share technology with us, but because so many of you have children.
Chinese Sentence: 我相信TED可以有非常重要的影响， 这不是因为我们可以分享技术， 而是因为你们中的许多人都有孩子。

English Sentence: And if you take this program out, and give it to your children, they have such a good opportunity to go out and do good, because they've got parents like you.
Chinese Sentence: 如果你愿意回家后，将我们的项目告诉你们的孩子， 那么他们就可以有一个极好的机会走出家门，做一些有意义的事， 因为他们有像你们这样的父母。

English Sentence: And it's been so clear how much you all care about trying to make this world a better place.
Chinese Sentence: 而且一切也都证明，大家都十分关注这个问题 关注如何让这个世界变得更好。

English Sentence: It's very encouraging.
Chinese Sentence: 这让人深受鼓舞。

English Sentence: But the kids do ask me -- and this won't take more than two minutes, I promise -- the kids say, "Dr. Jane, do you really have hope for the future?
Chinese Sentence: 但是孩子们的确会问我—— 我保证，我不会超过两分钟了—— 有孩子会说：“珍妮博士，你对未来真的抱有希望？

English Sentence: You travel, you see all these horrible things happening."
Chinese Sentence: 你去过很多地方，见过那么多可怕的事。”

English Sentence: Firstly, the human brain -- I don't need to say anything about that.
Chinese Sentence: 第一，人类的大脑——关于此我不必说什么。

English Sentence: Now that we know what the problems are around the world, human brains like yours are rising to solve those problems.
Chinese Sentence: 如今我们了解了世界各地存在的问题， 拥有诸位这样的大脑的人都会开始思考如何解决那些问题。

English Sentence: And we've talked a lot about that.
Chinese Sentence: 对此，我们已经说过了很多。

English Sentence: Secondly, the resilience of nature.
Chinese Sentence: 第二，大自然可以自我修复。

English Sentence: We can destroy a river, and we can bring it back to life.
Chinese Sentence: 我们可以摧毁一条河， 我们也可以使它恢复生机。

English Sentence: We can see a whole area desolated, and it can be brought back to bloom again, with time or a little help.
Chinese Sentence: 一片土地变为荒芜， 但只要有时间和一点帮助，它也可以重新变得生机盎然。

English Sentence: And thirdly, the last speaker talked about -- or the speaker before last, talked about the indomitable human spirit.
Chinese Sentence: 第三，上一个发言者，也许往前数第二个， 提及了人类不屈不挠的精神。

English Sentence: We are surrounded by the most amazing people who do things that seem to be absolutely impossible.
Chinese Sentence: 我们周围有许多从不气馁的人们， 他们做成了许多看似不可能的工作。

English Sentence: Nelson Mandela -- I take a little piece of limestone from Robben Island Prison, where he labored for 27 years, and came out with so little bitterness, he could lead his people from the horror of apartheid without a bloodbath.
Chinese Sentence: 比如说尼尔森·曼得拉——我从罗本岛监狱拿了一块石灰石 在那儿，曼得拉被监禁并劳作了27年， 他出狱后并不是心怀怨恨，而是领导人民， 用和平的方式走出了可怕的种族隔离。

English Sentence: Even after the 11th of September -- and I was in New York and I felt the fear -- nevertheless, there was so much human courage, so much love and so much compassion.
Chinese Sentence: 即使在911之后——那时我在纽约，非常害怕—— 我也感受到了恐慌——但是仍有那么多人，充满了勇气， 充满了爱和同情心。

English Sentence: And then as I went around the country after that and felt the fear -- the fear that was leading to people feeling they couldn't worry about the environment any more, in case they seemed not to be patriotic -- and I was trying to encourage them, somebody came up with a little quotation from Mahatma Gandhi, "If you look back through human history, you see that every evil regime has been overcome by good."
Chinese Sentence: 在那之后，我去了美国的其他地区，感受到了人们的恐惧—— 这样的恐惧让人们觉得 他们不应再去担心自然环境， 只关注恐怖主义，不然他们会看上去不爱国，—— 当时我尝试着鼓励他们， 有人走来告诉我一句圣雄甘地的话， “回顾人类历史， 一切恶势力终究被正义战胜。”

English Sentence: And just after that a woman brought me this little bell, and I want to end on this note.
Chinese Sentence: 然后，一个女士给了我这个小铃铛， 我想以这作为结束。

English Sentence: She said, "If you're talking about hope and peace, ring this.
Chinese Sentence: 她告诉我，“每当你说到希望和和平，就摇摇它。

English Sentence: This bell is made from metal from a defused landmine, from the killing fields of Pol Pot -- one of the most evil regimes in human history -- where people are now beginning to put their lives back together So, yes, there is hope, and where is the hope?
Chinese Sentence: 这个铃铛是由一个拆除引信的地雷造的， 它来自波尔布特的屠杀战场—— 那人类历史中最为罪恶的政权之一—— 现在，这个政权已经垮台， 那里的人们正恢复正常生活。 所以，是的，希望是有的，那希望在哪儿呢？

English Sentence: Is it out there with the politicians?
Chinese Sentence: 希望在政治家那儿吗？

English Sentence: It's in our hands.
Chinese Sentence: 希望在我们的手中。

English Sentence: It's in your hands and my hands and those of our children.
Chinese Sentence: 希望在你手中，在我手中， 在孩子们的手中。

English Sentence: It's really up to us.
Chinese Sentence: 一切的确由我们决定。

English Sentence: We're the ones who can make a difference.
Chinese Sentence: 只有我们，才能带来改变。

English Sentence: If we lead lives where we consciously leave the lightest possible ecological footprints, if we buy the things that are ethical for us to buy and don't buy the things that are not, we can change the world overnight.
Chinese Sentence: 如果我们在日常生活中， 尽量留下最轻的生态足迹， 如果我们只购买该买的东西 不买不该买的东西， 我们可以一夜之间改变世界。

English Sentence: Thank you.
Chinese Sentence: 谢谢

English Sentence: Thank you. It's really an honor and a privilege to be here spending my last day as a teenager.
Chinese Sentence: 谢谢各位！非常荣幸能够站在这里 与大家分享我19岁的最后一天

English Sentence: Today I want to talk to you about the future, but first I'm going to tell you a bit about the past.
Chinese Sentence: 今天我想跟大家谈谈未来 但是首先我要用一点时间讲讲我过去的经历

English Sentence: My story starts way before I was born.
Chinese Sentence: 这个故事要从我出生之前讲起

English Sentence: My grandmother was on a train to Auschwitz, the death camp.
Chinese Sentence: 我的外祖母曾经在开往死亡集中营奥斯维辛的一辆火车上

English Sentence: And she was going along the tracks, and the tracks split.
Chinese Sentence: 火车顺着轨道开呀开，开到一个轨道分叉处

English Sentence: And somehow -- we don't really know exactly the whole story -- but the train took the wrong track and went to a work camp rather than the death camp.
Chinese Sentence: 然后不知怎么地——没人知道倒底怎么回事——总之 火车开上了错误的轨道，开到了一处劳动集中营，而不是奥斯维辛

English Sentence: My grandmother survived and married my grandfather.
Chinese Sentence: 我的外祖母就这样幸免于难，然后嫁给了我的外祖父

English Sentence: They were living in Hungary, and my mother was born.
Chinese Sentence: 他们住在匈牙利时，生下了我母亲

English Sentence: And when my mother was two years old, the Hungarian revolution was raging, and they decided to escape Hungary.
Chinese Sentence: 我母亲两岁的时候 匈牙利革命爆发，于是外祖父母决定离开匈牙利

English Sentence: They got on a boat, and yet another divergence -- the boat was either going to Canada or to Australia.
Chinese Sentence: 他们上了一条船，又一次的阴差阳错 这条船可能开往加拿大或者是澳大利亚

English Sentence: They got on and didn't know where they were going, and ended up in Canada.
Chinese Sentence: 他们上船的时候并不知道会到哪里, 最后船把他们送去了加拿大

English Sentence: So, to make a long story short, they came to Canada.
Chinese Sentence: 嗯，长话短说，他们到了加拿大

English Sentence: My grandmother was a chemist. She worked at the Banting Institute in Toronto, and at 44 she died of stomach cancer. I never met my grandmother, but I carry on her name -- her exact name, Eva Vertes -- and I like to think I carry on her scientific passion, too.

English Sentence: I found this passion not far from here, actually, when I was nine years old.
Chinese Sentence: 事实上, 我找到热情的地方离这儿并不远, 那年我九岁

English Sentence: My family was on a road trip and we were in the Grand Canyon.
Chinese Sentence: 我们全家一起自驾游到美国大峡谷

English Sentence: And I had never been a reader when I was young -- my dad had tried me with the Hardy Boys; I tried Nancy Drew; I tried all that -- and I just didn't like reading books.
Chinese Sentence: 在那之前我一直都不喜欢阅读 爸爸曾让我试着读一下哈迪男孩，我自己也试着读过南希·朱尔 我全都试过了, 但我就是不喜欢读书

English Sentence: And my mother bought this book when we were at the Grand Canyon called "The Hot Zone." It was all about the outbreak of the Ebola virus.
Chinese Sentence: 在大峡谷时我母亲买了一本书给我 叫做”高危地带“，讲的是埃博拉病毒的爆发

English Sentence: And something about it just kind of drew me towards it.
Chinese Sentence: 我被其中的某些部分吸引住了

English Sentence: There was this big sort of bumpy-looking virus on the cover, and I just wanted to read it. I picked up that book, and as we drove from the edge of the Grand Canyon to Big Sur, and to, actually, here where we are today, in Monterey, I read that book, and from when I was reading that book, I knew that I wanted to have a life in medicine.
Chinese Sentence: 书的封面是一张表面崎岖不平的病毒的图片 我突然有了阅读它的欲望，我拿起了这本书 接下来的旅途中, 从大峡谷边缘 到大瑟尔，再到我们今天所在的蒙特雷 我一直在读这本书，从那时起 我就知道我要把医学作为我一生的追求

English Sentence: I wanted to be like the explorers I'd read about in the book, who went into the jungles of Africa, went into the research labs and just tried to figure out what this deadly virus was. So from that moment on, I read every medical book I could get my hands on, and I just loved it so much.
Chinese Sentence: 我想要像书中的探险家一样 深入非洲的丛林 走进实验室，试着搞清楚 这种致命的病毒到底是什么，从那开始，我读遍了所有我可以找到的医学书籍 并且深深沉迷于此

English Sentence: I was a passive observer of the medical world.
Chinese Sentence: 在医学的世界里，我是个被动的学习者

English Sentence: It wasn't until I entered high school that I thought, "Maybe now, you know -- being a big high school kid -- I can maybe become an active part of this big medical world."
Chinese Sentence: 一直到了高中，我才想到 ”我已经是高中生了,或许从现在开始 我可以动手做点儿什么了”

English Sentence: I was 14, and I emailed professors at the local university to see if maybe I could go work in their lab. And hardly anyone responded.
Chinese Sentence: 那时我14岁，我给当地大学的教授发了很多封邮件 看看有没有可能在他们的实验室里工作，几乎没有人给我答复

English Sentence: But I mean, why would they respond to a 14-year-old, anyway?
Chinese Sentence: 但是，他们也没有理由理会一个14岁的小丫头片子，对吧？

English Sentence: And I got to go talk to one professor, Dr. Jacobs, who accepted me into the lab.
Chinese Sentence: 然后我找到雅各布斯教授, 跟他谈了谈 他同意我进实验室

English Sentence: At that time, I was really interested in neuroscience and wanted to do a research project in neurology -- specifically looking at the effects of heavy metals on the developing nervous system.
Chinese Sentence: 那时，我对神经科学很有兴趣 希望能研究一项有关神经病学的课题 尤其是研究重金属对发育中的神经系统的影响

English Sentence: So I started that, and worked in his lab for a year, and found the results that I guess you'd expect to find when you feed fruit flies heavy metals -- that it really, really impaired the nervous system.
Chinese Sentence: 我花了一年的时间去研究 最后得到了大家都能想到的结果 如果给果蝇的食物中加入重金属——将会导致很严重的神经系统损伤

English Sentence: The spinal cord had breaks. The neurons were crossing in every which way.
Chinese Sentence: 脊髓会折断, 神经元也会随意交叉

English Sentence: And from then I wanted to look not at impairment, but at prevention of impairment.
Chinese Sentence: 从那时起我就把重点转移到了该如何预防损伤上面

English Sentence: So that's what led me to Alzheimer's. I started reading about Alzheimer's and tried to familiarize myself with the research, and at the same time when I was in the -- I was reading in the medical library one day, and I read this article about something called "purine derivatives."
Chinese Sentence: 这件事激发了我对阿尔茨海默氏症的兴趣。我开始阅读相关的资料 并使自己的熟悉相关的研究 在同一时间，当我在...... 有一天，我在医学图书馆读到一篇文章 是关于嘌呤衍生物的

English Sentence: And they seemed to have cell growth-promoting properties.
Chinese Sentence: 他们似乎有促进细胞生长的功能

English Sentence: And being naive about the whole field, I kind of thought, "Oh, you have cell death in Alzheimer's which is causing the memory deficit, and then you have this compound -- purine derivatives -- that are promoting cell growth."
Chinese Sentence: 在对这整个领域几乎一无所知的情况下，我试想 “哦，阿尔茨海默症中会有细胞死亡 这导致了记忆减退，现在有这种化合物—— 嘌呤衍生物——可以促进细胞的生长。“

English Sentence: And so I thought, "Maybe if it can promote cell growth, it can inhibit cell death, too."
Chinese Sentence: 所以我想，“如果它能促进细胞生长， 它也可以抑制细胞死亡。“

English Sentence: And so that's the project that I pursued for that year, and it's continuing now as well, and found that a specific purine derivative called "guanidine" had inhibited the cell growth by approximately 60 percent.
Chinese Sentence: 那一年我都在研究这种可能性 研究进行的很顺利 我发现了一种叫做胍的嘌呤衍生物 可以抑制约60%的细胞生长

English Sentence: So I presented those results at the International Science Fair, which was just one of the most amazing experiences of my life.
Chinese Sentence: 我向国际科学博览会提交了这项成果， 这是我一生中最难忘的经历之一

English Sentence: And there I was awarded "Best in the World in Medicine," which allowed me to get in, or at least get a foot in the door of the big medical world.
Chinese Sentence: 我被授予“世界最佳医学”荣誉 这使我进入了，或者至少迈出了我在医学研究领域的第一步

English Sentence: And from then on, since I was now in this huge exciting world, I wanted to explore it all. I wanted it all at once, but knew I couldn't really get that.
Chinese Sentence: 从那时起，既然我进入了这个精彩纷呈的世界 我想探索一切。我希望能马上了解一切，但也知道很难做到这一点

English Sentence: And I stumbled across something called "cancer stem cells."
Chinese Sentence: 一个偶然的机会我了解到癌症干细胞的存在

English Sentence: And this is really what I want to talk to you about today -- about cancer.
Chinese Sentence: 这也是我今天真正想和大家讨论的主题——癌症

English Sentence: At first when I heard of cancer stem cells, I didn't really know how to put the two together. I'd heard of stem cells, and I'd heard of them as the panacea of the future -- the therapy of many diseases to come in the future, perhaps.
Chinese Sentence: 起初，我听到癌症干细胞这个名词 我真的不知道“癌症”和“干细胞”这两者是如何结合起来的。我听说的干细胞， 是未来的灵丹妙药—— 假以时日, 或许可以治愈许多疾病

English Sentence: But I'd heard of cancer as the most feared disease of our time, so how did the good and bad go together?
Chinese Sentence: 但是，我也听说癌症是这个时代最可怕的疾病 所以好的和坏的究竟是怎么结合到一起的？

English Sentence: Last summer I worked at Stanford University, doing some research on cancer stem cells.
Chinese Sentence: 去年夏天，我到斯坦福大学做了一些有关癌症干细胞的研究

English Sentence: And while I was doing this, I was reading the cancer literature, trying to -- again -- familiarize myself with this new medical field.
Chinese Sentence: 这段时间，我读了很多有关癌症的文献 试图让自己熟悉这一新的医学领域。

English Sentence: And it seemed that tumors actually begin from a stem cell.
Chinese Sentence: 我了解到, 肿瘤确实是从干细胞开始的

English Sentence: This fascinated me. The more I read, the more I looked at cancer differently and almost became less fearful of it.
Chinese Sentence: 这使我着迷。我读的文献越多，对癌症的的了解就越多 几乎不再惧怕癌症了

English Sentence: It seems that cancer is a direct result to injury.
Chinese Sentence: 研究表明，癌症是由损伤直接导致的

English Sentence: If you smoke, you damage your lung tissue, and then lung cancer arises.
Chinese Sentence: 如果你吸烟，损害了你的肺部组织，就会引起肺癌。

English Sentence: If you drink, you damage your liver, and then liver cancer occurs.
Chinese Sentence: 如果你喝酒，损害了你的肝脏，就会引起肝癌。

English Sentence: And it was really interesting -- there were articles correlating if you have a bone fracture, and then bone cancer arises.
Chinese Sentence: 有趣的是, 很多文献中都有相似的研究结果 如果你骨折，就会引起骨瘤。

English Sentence: Because what stem cells are -- they're these phenomenal cells that really have the ability to differentiate into any type of tissue.
Chinese Sentence: 起因是干细胞的特性——这些 惊人细胞的确有分化的能力 在任何类型的组织中。

English Sentence: So, if the body is sensing that you have damage to an organ and then it's initiating cancer, it's almost as if this is a repair response.
Chinese Sentence: 因此，如果身体感应到有受损器官 它就按下了癌症的启动按钮，把它当成一种修复反应

English Sentence: And the cancer, the body is saying the lung tissue is damaged, we need to repair the lung. And cancer is originating in the lung trying to repair -- because you have this excessive proliferation of these remarkable cells that really have the potential to become lung tissue.
Chinese Sentence: 身体说肺组织受到了损害 需要修复,癌症便由此而生 试图修复的过程中, 这些细胞会过度增生 这些细胞有成为肺组织的潜力

English Sentence: But it's almost as if the body has originated this ingenious response, but can't quite control it.
Chinese Sentence: 不过, 好像身体引发了这个巧妙的反应程序 却不能完全控制它

English Sentence: It hasn't yet become fine-tuned enough to finish what has been initiated.
Chinese Sentence: 它不能精确调整这个已经开始的过程

English Sentence: So this really, really fascinated me.
Chinese Sentence: 因此，这真的，真的使我着迷。

English Sentence: And I really think that we can't think about cancer -- let alone any disease -- in such black-and-white terms.
Chinese Sentence: 我真的认为，我们不能用非黑即白的眼光 来看待癌症——更不用说是其他疾病了

English Sentence: If we eliminate cancer the way we're trying to do now, with chemotherapy and radiation, we're bombarding the body or the cancer with toxins, or with radiation, trying to kill it.
Chinese Sentence: 如果我们用化疗和放疗去治愈癌症 我们在用毒素或辐射轰击身体或癌细胞，试图杀死它。

English Sentence: It's almost as if we're getting back to this starting point.
Chinese Sentence: 这可能会让我们回到起点。

English Sentence: We're removing the cancer cells, but we're revealing the previous damage that the body has tried to fix.
Chinese Sentence: 我们是在消除癌细胞，但同时身体也会试图修复这些 一再被揭开的损伤

English Sentence: Shouldn't we think about manipulation, rather than elimination?
Chinese Sentence: 我们是不是应该思考如何控制癌细胞，而不是消除它们？

English Sentence: If somehow we can cause these cells to differentiate -- to become bone tissue, lung tissue, liver tissue, whatever that cancer has been put there to do -- it would be a repair process. We'd end up better than we were before cancer.
Chinese Sentence: 如果我们可以想办法使这些细胞分化 成为骨组织，肺组织，肝组织， 不管哪个部位的癌细胞 那将会是一个修复损伤的过程。我们会得到比以前治疗更好的结果。

English Sentence: And while I was reading all these articles about cancer, it seemed that the articles -- a lot of them -- focused on, you know, the genetics of breast cancer, and the genesis and the progression of breast cancer -- tracking the cancer through the body, tracing where it is, where it goes.

English Sentence: For me, every day is a new thing.
Chinese Sentence: 对我来说，每一天都是全新的，

Chinese Sentence: 虽然你也可以列出你不喜欢他/她的地方 但对缺点马上置之不理，然后全力去爱她/他

English Sentence: As Chaucer said, "Love is blind."
Chinese Sentence: 就像乔叟说的那样，“爱情是盲目的”

English Sentence: In trying to understand romantic love, I decided I would read poetry from all over the world, and I just want to give you one very short poem from eighth-century China, because it's an almost perfect example of a man who is focused totally on a particular woman.
Chinese Sentence: 为了理解浪漫爱情 我决定阅读来自世界各地的诗歌 现在我想给你们读一首写于八世纪中国的小诗 因为它几近完美的展现了一个男人是怎样全身心的关注一个女人

English Sentence: It's a little bit like when you are madly in love with somebody and you walk into a parking lot -- their car is different from every other car in the parking lot.
Chinese Sentence: 就像一个人疯狂的爱上一个人的时候， 这个人走进停车场。 他会觉得这个人的车与其他任何车都不一样

English Sentence: is different from every other wine glass at the dinner party.
Chinese Sentence: 这个人晚宴上的红酒杯也和其他任何的酒杯不一样

English Sentence: And in this case, a man got hooked on a bamboo sleeping mat.
Chinese Sentence: 在这个故事里，一个男人迷上了一张竹席

English Sentence: And it goes like this.
Chinese Sentence: 这首诗是诗人元稹所写的：

English Sentence: It's by a guy called Yuan Zhen.
Chinese Sentence: 竹簟衬重茵，未忍都令卷。

English Sentence: The night I brought you home, I watched you roll it out."
Chinese Sentence: 忆昨初来日，看君自施展

English Sentence: He became hooked on a sleeping mat, probably because of elevated activity of dopamine in his brain, just like with you and me. But anyway, not only does this person take on special meaning, you focus your attention on them.
Chinese Sentence: 他之所以迷上一个竹席， 可能跟你我一样， 因为头脑里的多巴胺增多而引起的反应 但不管怎么说，不仅这个人对你来说有特殊的含义 你会全身心的关注他或她。

English Sentence: You aggrandize them. But you have intense energy.
Chinese Sentence: 你会对他/她极度的吹捧。而且你的精力旺盛异常

English Sentence: As one Polynesian said, "I felt like jumping in the sky."
Chinese Sentence: 就像一个波利尼亚人说的那样：“我觉得仿佛飞到了空中”

English Sentence: You're up all night. You're walking till dawn.
Chinese Sentence: 你会整晚都睡不着。你会一直走黎明

English Sentence: You feel intense elation when things are going well; mood swings into horrible despair when things are going poorly.
Chinese Sentence: 当事情进展顺利的时候，你会觉得兴高采烈 当事情不顺利的时候，你又会陷入极度的失望和恐慌。

English Sentence: Real dependence on this person.
Chinese Sentence: 你完全依赖于这个人了

English Sentence: As one businessman in New York said to me, "Anything she liked, I liked."
Chinese Sentence: 就像一个纽约的商人对我说的， “她喜欢的任何东西我都喜欢”

English Sentence: Simple. Romantic love is very simple.
Chinese Sentence: 简单，爱情就是那么简单。

English Sentence: You become extremely sexually possessive.
Chinese Sentence: 你会对性有极强的占有欲。

English Sentence: You know, if you're just sleeping with somebody casually, you don't really care if they're sleeping with somebody else.
Chinese Sentence: 你知道，如果你只是随随便便和一个人上床， 你并不会在意他/她是否和其他人上床

English Sentence: But the moment you fall in love, you become extremely sexually possessive of them.
Chinese Sentence: 但当你陷入爱情的时候 你对性会有极强的占有欲

English Sentence: I think there's a Darwinian purpose to this.
Chinese Sentence: 我想这种现象是遵循尔达文进化论的，也促进了人类的进化

English Sentence: The whole point of this is to pull two people together strongly enough to begin to rear babies as a team.
Chinese Sentence: 因为爱情让两个人紧紧绑在了一起， 这种关系牢固到足以让两个人在一起生儿育女

English Sentence: But the main characteristics of romantic love are craving: an intense craving to be with a particular person, not just sexually, but emotionally.
Chinese Sentence: 但爱情最重要的特征是渴望 对某一个人，不仅是性上的，还包括感情上的渴望。

English Sentence: It would be nice to go to bed with them, but you want them to call you on the telephone, to invite you out, etc., to tell you that they love you.
Chinese Sentence: 当然能和他/她同床共枕是很好的， 但你更期待他/她会给你打电话，约你出去，等等 希望他告诉你他爱你

English Sentence: The other main characteristic is motivation.
Chinese Sentence: 爱情另外一个主要的特征是动机。

English Sentence: The motor in the brain begins to crank, and you want this person.
Chinese Sentence: 你已经迫不及待的开始行动，你想得到这个人。

English Sentence: And last but not least, it is an obsession.
Chinese Sentence: 爱情的最后一个也是同样重要的特征是痴迷

English Sentence: Before I put these people in the MRI machine, I would ask them all kinds of questions.
Chinese Sentence: 当我让他们进入核磁共振机之前 我会问他们各种各样的问题

English Sentence: But my most important question was always the same.
Chinese Sentence: 但最重要的问题始终是一个

English Sentence: It was: "What percentage of the day and night do you think about this person?"
Chinese Sentence: “你一天之中有多少时间是在想念这个人的？”

English Sentence: And indeed, they would say, "All day. All night. I can never stop thinking about him or her."
Chinese Sentence: 他们会说，“整天整夜。从来没停止过想念”

English Sentence: And then, the very last question -- I would always have to work myself up to this question, because I'm not a psychologist.
Chinese Sentence: 然后，我会问他们最后一个问题， 我经常会想方设法引导他们去回答这个问题 因为我不是一个心理学家

English Sentence: I don't work with people in any kind of traumatic situation.
Chinese Sentence: 我没法治愈人们心灵的创伤

English Sentence: My final question was always the same.
Chinese Sentence: 这个最后的问题也始终是那一个：

English Sentence: I would say, "Would you die for him or her?"
Chinese Sentence: “你会为这个人去死吗？”

English Sentence: And, indeed, these people would say "Yes!"
Chinese Sentence: 这些人会说“会的！”

English Sentence: as if I had asked them to pass the salt.
Chinese Sentence: 就好像我请他们把盐递给我那样理所当然

English Sentence: I was just staggered by it. So we scanned their brains, looking at a photograph of their sweetheart and looking at a neutral photograph, with a distraction task in between.
Chinese Sentence: 对这样的回答，我感到很震惊。 我让他们先看一幅爱人的照片， 然后再让他们看一幅不相关的照片，并监测了他们大脑的活动

English Sentence: So we could look at the same brain when it was in that heightened state and when it was in a resting state.
Chinese Sentence: 我们会发现同一个大脑在某一时刻达到最强烈的活动状态 又在什么时候处于休息的状态

English Sentence: And we found activity in a lot of brain regions.
Chinese Sentence: 我们也发现相当多的大脑区域变得活跃

English Sentence: In fact, one of the most important was a brain region that becomes active when you feel the rush of cocaine.
Chinese Sentence: 而事实上我们最关注的一个大脑区域 是那个让你对可卡因感到渴求的大脑区域

English Sentence: And indeed, that's exactly what happens.
Chinese Sentence: 而这正是人们看到爱人照片时的反应

English Sentence: I began to realize that romantic love is not an emotion.
Chinese Sentence: 我开始意识到浪漫爱情并不仅仅是一种情绪

English Sentence: In fact, I had always thought it was a series of emotions, from very high to very low.
Chinese Sentence: 我曾经认为爱情就是一系列的情绪 从非常强烈到非常微弱的

English Sentence: But actually, it's a drive. It comes from the motor of the mind, the wanting part of the mind, the craving part of the mind.
Chinese Sentence: 但事实上，爱情是一种驱动力 它来自于心灵深处的动力 来自于我们内心的欲望，一种强烈的愿望

English Sentence: The kind of part of the mind when you're reaching for that piece of chocolate, when you want to win that promotion at work.
Chinese Sentence: 这种动力， 就像你想要得到那一块巧克力一样 就像你想要在工作中获得晋升一样

English Sentence: The motor of the brain. It's a drive.
Chinese Sentence: 它在驱动我们的大脑活动，它是我们的驱动力

English Sentence: And in fact, I think it's more powerful than the sex drive.
Chinese Sentence: 我认为这种动力比性的动力更为的强大

English Sentence: You know, if you ask somebody to go to bed with you, and they say, "No, thank you," you certainly don't kill yourself or slip into a clinical depression.
Chinese Sentence: 当你问别人是否愿意和你上床，如果这个人说“不” 你肯定不会因为这个自杀或是患上忧郁症
